analyzed: blo dang rig bya yongs spangs shing //

analyzed: gal te mthong ba yod min na //

analyzed: dngos po ma yin rgyu yang min //

analyzed: phung min phung la gnas pa min //

analyzed: mi bya // yod par yang ni mi brtag go /

analyzed: bdag dang bdag med slad pas na //

analyzed: nyes pa kun las rnam grol zhing //

analyzed: nga yi tshul ni rab rtog na //

analyzed: de ni yang dag rtog pa ste //

original: 'dren pa che la de mi smod //
analyzed: 'dren pa che la de mi smod //

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la yang 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: legs so // legs so //

analyzed: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la rab tu dbye zhing bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

analyzed: nga ni de bzhin gshegs pa dngos po med par bshad pa'ang ma yin /

analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pas chos thams cad smos pa'ang ma yin /

analyzed: rkyen la ltos pa'ang ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med kyang don med ba'ang ma yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: ma skyes @424a *//
analyzed: ma skyes @424a *//

analyzed: pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam grangs kyi tshig yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: 'jug pa'ang med par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'ang med par rab tu shes so //

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis ni rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis ni rab tu mi shes te /

analyzed: @425a *// mchod par byed de /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs tha dad pa dbang po dang / brgya byin dang / grong khyer 'jig pa lta bu ma shes shing /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: skyes bu blun po de dag 'di skad du don ni ji bzhin pa nyid de /

analyzed: sgra las don gzhan ma yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: don ma lus pa med pa'i phyir sgra las gzhan ci'ang med do //

analyzed: sgra 'ba' zhig go zhes zer ro //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sgra thams cad ni yi ger lhung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra thams cad ni yi ger lhung ba'o //

original: don ni ma lhung ba ste /
analyzed: don ni ma lhung ba ste /

analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa spangs pa'i phyir dang / skye ba len pa med cing lus med pa'i phyir ro //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi @425b ger lhung ba'i chos mi ston te /

analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi yod pa dang / med pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan du na yi ger ma lhung bas chos ston to //
translated: Because the existence and nonexistence of syllables are not observed. Otherwise, he teaches the Dharma without falling into syllables.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: gal te kha cig 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa ni yi ger lhung ba'i chos mi ston to zhes zer ba ni brdzun du smra ba ste /
translated: if someone were to say, “The Tathāgata does not teach the Dharma that falls into syllables,” that would be a lie.

original: chos nyid ni yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid ni yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is free from letters.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

analyzed: blo gros chen po / nga la sogs pa sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the buddhas, including myself, have not taught, nor will we teach, even a single letter.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because phenomena are free from letters.

original: don dang mi ldan par 'chad pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dang mi ldan par 'chad pa'ang ma yin te /

original: brjod pa ni sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa ni sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because expression is the conceptualization of sentient beings.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ma bshad na ni bstan pa'i chos rnams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: if all phenomena were not taught, then the taught Dharma would perish.

original: bstan pa'i chos zhig na ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos zhig na ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the taught Dharma perishes, then the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas would not exist.

original: de dag med na ni gang zhig su la ci zhig bshad de /
analyzed: de dag med na ni gang zhig su la ci zhig bshad de /
translated: If they do not exist, then who would teach what to whom?

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bshad pa brjod pa'i sgra la mngon par chags par mi bya zhing /

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mdo sde'i chos rnams rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mdo sde'i chos rnams rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
translated: The sūtra Dharma should be explained extensively according to the intention.

original: 'di ltar @426a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar @426a *//
translated: Thus,

original: sems can rnams kyi re ba dang / nyon mongs pa ni gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi re ba dang / nyon mongs pa ni gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the hopes and afflictions of sentient beings are not the same.

original: nga dang sangs rgyas gzhan rnams kyis mos pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyi sems can rnams sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nga dang sangs rgyas gzhan rnams kyis mos pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyi sems can rnams sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir chos bstan par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: I and other buddhas should teach the Dharma for sentient beings with various different inclinations in order to turn back the mind, mentality, and consciousness.

analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi gnas thob pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for attaining the stage of the noble wisdom of individual knowledge.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos thams cad snang ba med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad snang ba med pa /
translated: all phenomena are non-appearing,

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa /
translated: understood as merely appearances of one's own mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis don la rton par bya'i yi ge la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis spangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis don la rton par bya'i yi ge la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who have abandoned the two types of conceptualization should rely on the meaning and not rely on the words.

original: blo gros chen po /🔽gal te rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / gal te rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mahamati,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la yi ge la rton pa de dag ni bdag kyang don dam pa las nyams par byed la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la yi ge la rton pa de dag ni bdag kyang don dam pa las nyams par byed la /
translated: if there are sons or daughters of noble family who rely on the words, they will cause themselves to fall from the ultimate truth,

original: gzhan yang rtogs par byed mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtogs par byed mi nus te /
translated: and they will be unable to cause others to understand.

original: lta ba ngan pa'i rgyud du lhung bar 'khor rnams la sgrogs par byed de /🔽chos thams cad dang / sa thams cad dang / mtshan ma thams cad la mi mkhas pas tshig gi rnam grangs rtogs pas khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i rgyud du lhung bar 'khor rnams la sgrogs par byed de / chos thams cad dang / sa thams cad dang / mtshan ma thams cad la mi mkhas pas tshig gi rnam grangs rtogs pas khong du mi chud do //
translated: They will proclaim to their retinue that they have fallen into a lineage of bad views.🔽Because they are not skilled in all dharmas, all stages, and all signs, they do not comprehend through realizing the categories of words.

original: gal te chos thams cad dang / sa thams cad dang / mtshan ma thams cad la mkhas pa dang / tshig gi rnam grangs rtogs par khong du chud @426b cing dngos po'i don dang ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dang / sa thams cad dang / mtshan ma thams cad la mkhas pa dang / tshig gi rnam grangs rtogs par khong du chud @426b cing dngos po'i don dang ldan par gyur na /
translated: If they were skilled in all dharmas, all stages, and all signs, and if they comprehended through realizing the categories of words and possessed the meaning of things,

original: de yang dag pa mtshan ma med pa'i bde bas bdag nyid tshim par byed cing sems can rnams kyang theg pa chen po mnyam pa nyid la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: de yang dag pa mtshan ma med pa'i bde bas bdag nyid tshim par byed cing sems can rnams kyang theg pa chen po mnyam pa nyid la 'god par byed do //
translated: Moreover, one should satisfy oneself with the bliss of the authentic signless, and one should establish sentient beings in the sameness of the Great Vehicle.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: theg pa chen po yongs su bzung na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po yongs su bzung na /
translated: if one upholds the Great Vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one upholds the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams yongs su bzung bas ni sems can thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams yongs su bzung bas ni sems can thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By upholding the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas, one upholds all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bzung bas ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bzung bas ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By upholding all sentient beings, one upholds the sublime Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung bas ni sangs rgyas kyi dung rgyun mi gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung bas ni sangs rgyas kyi dung rgyun mi gcod pa yin no //
translated: By upholding the sublime Dharma, one ensures the continuity of the Buddha's lineage.

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi gcod pa ni gnas khyad par can du 'jug pa'i shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The lineage of the buddhas is not cut off, and one attains the cognition that enters the special abode.

original: gnas khyad par can du 'jug pa'i shes pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni rtag par brdzus te skye zhing theg pa chen po rab tu 'jog pas dbang bcu'i stobs kyis gzugs sna tshogs yongs su ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas khyad par can du 'jug pa'i shes pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni rtag par brdzus te skye zhing theg pa chen po rab tu 'jog pas dbang bcu'i stobs kyis gzugs sna tshogs yongs su ston par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have attained the cognition that enters the special abode are always miraculously born, and by establishing the Mahāyāna, through the power of the ten masteries they manifest various forms.

original: sems can gyi cha byad dang / mos pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams rtogs par khong du chud pas yang @427a *//
analyzed: sems can gyi cha byad dang / mos pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams rtogs par khong du chud pas yang @427a *//
translated: Comprehending the characteristics of the forms, aspirations, and afflictions of sentient beings,

original: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: they teach the Dharma in accordance with reality.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid pas gzhan ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid pas gzhan ma yin pa ste /
translated: Here, teaching in accordance with reality means that it is not otherwise due to reality.

analyzed: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of neither coming nor going, and the complete pacification of all conceptual elaborations, is called ‘suchness.’

original: blo gros chen po /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis sgra ji bzhin du gzung zhing mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo rnams kyis sgra ji bzhin du gzung zhing mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: sons or daughters of noble family should not grasp or cling to the words as they are,

original: de kho na nyid ni ming dang / yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni ming dang / yi ge dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because suchness is free from names and letters.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ji ltar blun po kha cig la sor mo'i rtse mos dngos po bstan na blun po de sor mo'i rtse mo la lta bas yang dag pa'i don mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: ji ltar blun po kha cig la sor mo'i rtse mos dngos po bstan na blun po de sor mo'i rtse mo la lta bas yang dag pa'i don mi 'thob bo //
translated: just as when something is pointed out with the tip of a finger to some fools, those fools, looking at the tip of the finger, do not obtain the correct meaning.

original: de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyang sgra ji bzhin gyi sor mo'i rtse mo 'dzin cing mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyang sgra ji bzhin gyi sor mo'i rtse mo 'dzin cing mngon par zhen te /
translated: In the same way, foolish ordinary beings grasp and cling to the words as they are, like the tip of a finger.

original: 'chi ba la thug gi bar du yongs su mi gtong bas sgra ji bzhin gyi sor mo'i rtse mo spangs pa don dam pa'i de kho na nyid 'thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug gi bar du yongs su mi gtong bas sgra ji bzhin gyi sor mo'i rtse mo spangs pa don dam pa'i de kho na nyid 'thob par mi nus so //
translated: Since they do not let go of it until they die, they are unable to attain the ultimate reality that is the abandonment of the literal tip of the finger, the ultimate truth.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na / byis pa chung du rnams ni zas g-yos su byas pa rnams bza' ba'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: dper na / byis pa chung du rnams ni zas g-yos su byas pa rnams bza' ba'i rigs kyi /

analyzed: g-yos su ma byas pa rnams ni bza' ba'i mi rigs pa las /
translated: but it is not suitable for them to eat uncooked food.

original: gal te g-yos su ma byas pa zos na smad nad slong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te g-yos su ma byas pa zos na smad nad slong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they eat uncooked food, it will cause them to have diarrhea.

original: kha zas rim gyis g-yos su bya ba mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha zas rim gyis g-yos su bya ba mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not know how to gradually digest food.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: @427b de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'ang thabs kyis mngon par ma bsgrubs na mdzes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @427b de bzhin du skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'ang thabs kyis mngon par ma bsgrubs na mdzes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, if non-arising and non-ceasing are not accomplished by means, they will not be beautiful.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: thabs kyis mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson par bya zhing sor mo'i rtse mo la lta ba ltar sgra'i rjes su 'brang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis mngon par bsgrub pa la brtson par bya zhing sor mo'i rtse mo la lta ba ltar sgra'i rjes su 'brang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should strive to accomplish it by means of skillful means, and not follow after mere words, as if one were looking at something with the tip of a finger.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de'i phyir / blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de kho na'i don la thabs kyis mngon par brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la thabs kyis mngon par brtson par bya'o //
translated: one should strive to accomplish the meaning of reality by means of skillful means.

original: de la de kho na'i don ni rab tu dpen pa ste /
analyzed: de la de kho na'i don ni rab tu dpen pa ste /
translated: In that regard, the meaning of reality is utterly secluded,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu'i //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu'i //
translated: the cause of nirvāṇa,

original: sgra ni rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: while sound accords with conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni 'khor ba sdud pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni 'khor ba sdud pa'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la de kho na nyid kyi don ni mang du thos pa las thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid kyi don ni mang du thos pa las thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the meaning of reality is attained through much learning.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mang du thos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mang du thos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: much learning is as follows:

original: don la mkhas pa yin gyi sgra la mkhas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don la mkhas pa yin gyi sgra la mkhas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is being skilled in the meaning, not being skilled in words.

original: don la mkhas pa ni mu stegs can gyi smra ba thams cad kyi rjes su mi 'brang bas bdag nyid kyang rjes su 'brang bar mi byed la gzhan dag kyang rjes su 'brang bar byed du mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: don la mkhas pa ni mu stegs can gyi smra ba thams cad kyi rjes su mi 'brang bas bdag nyid kyang rjes su 'brang bar mi byed la gzhan dag kyang rjes su 'brang bar byed du mi 'jug ste /
translated: The wise in terms of meaning do not follow any of the tīrthikas' doctrines, and so they do not follow them themselves and do not cause others to follow them.

original: 'di ni yon tan chen po mang du thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan chen po mang du thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called having many great qualities and being learned.

original: de bas na don 'dod pa rnams kyis mang du thos pa la bsten par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na don 'dod pa rnams kyis mang du thos pa la bsten par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, those who desire the meaning should rely on the learned.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: don la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: don la mkhas pa'o //
translated: the wise in terms of meaning.

original: 'di las bzlog pa sgra la mngon par zhen pa de dag ni yongs su spang bar bya'o //🔽de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' blo @428a *//
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa sgra la mngon par zhen pa de dag ni yongs su spang bar bya'o // de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' blo @428a *//
translated: Those who are attached to the sound of words should be abandoned.

original: gros chen po sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: gros chen po sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, the bodhisattva Mahāmati, through the Buddha's blessing, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa zhes rab tu phye ba de ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa ci'ang ma mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa zhes rab tu phye ba de ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa ci'ang ma mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, the distinction you make between non-arising and non-cessation is not at all surprising.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis rgyu'ang ma skyes ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis rgyu'ang ma skyes ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: The tīrthikas also say that the cause is non-arisen and unceasing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma 'gags pa'i 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni ma skyes ba dang / ma 'gags pa'o zhes gsungs /

translated: The Blessed One also says that space, the cessation that is a result of the absence of conditions, and the realm of nirvāṇa are non-arisen and unceasing.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: mu stegs can rnams kyang rgyu las 'jig rten rnams skye'o zhes mchi la /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyang rgyu las 'jig rten rnams skye'o zhes mchi la /
translated: the tīrthikas also say that the world arises from a cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis rkyen byas nas 'jig rten rnams skye bar bka' stsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis rkyen byas nas 'jig rten rnams skye bar bka' stsal te /
translated: The Blessed One also says that the world arises through the conditions of ignorance, craving, action, and conceptualization.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen 'di ming la bye brag mchis par bas so //
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen 'di ming la bye brag mchis par bas so //
translated: I see no difference between the cause and these conditions in name.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The causes and conditions of external things are also like this.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis yang mu stegs can gyi smra ba'ang bye brag ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis yang mu stegs can gyi smra ba'ang bye brag ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, the doctrines of the tīrthikas are not different.

original: mu stegs can yang 'di skad du rdul phra mo dang / gtso bo dang / dbang phyug dang / skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa rdzas dgu dang bcas pa ma skyes ma 'gags @428b pa'o zhes mchi la /
analyzed: mu stegs can yang 'di skad du rdul phra mo dang / gtso bo dang / dbang phyug dang / skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa rdzas dgu dang bcas pa ma skyes ma 'gags @428b pa'o zhes mchi la /
translated: The tīrthikas say, ‘The nine substances such as the subtle particle, the primal substance, Īśvara, and the lord of beings are not produced and do not cease.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pas yod pa dang / med pa mi dmigs so zhes bka' stsal /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pas yod pa dang / med pa mi dmigs so zhes bka' stsal /
translated: The Blessed One has also said, ‘Because all things are not produced and do not cease, existence and nonexistence are not perceived.’

original: mu stegs can rnams kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi 'jig pas rang gi mtshan nyid mi skye mi 'gag go /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyang 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi 'jig pas rang gi mtshan nyid mi skye mi 'gag go /
translated: The tīrthikas say, ‘Because the four great elements do not perish, their characteristics are not produced and do not cease.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams ni rtag par 'byung ba chen po nyid de /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams ni rtag par 'byung ba chen po nyid de /
translated: The four great elements are always the great elements.’

original: 'gro ba kun la khyab par 'jug kyang rang bzhin mi 'dor ro zhes mchis pas na /
analyzed: 'gro ba kun la khyab par 'jug kyang rang bzhin mi 'dor ro zhes mchis pas na /
translated: Although it pervades all beings, it does not abandon its own nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: The Buddha’s words are also like this.

original: de'i slad du bdag 'di skad du ngo mtshar che ba ma lags so zhes mchi'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du bdag 'di skad du ngo mtshar che ba ma lags so zhes mchi'o //
translated: Therefore, I say that this is not a great wonder.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ngo mtshar che zhing mu stegs can rnams las khyad par du gyur ba'i bye brag bshad du gsol /
analyzed: ngo mtshar che zhing mu stegs can rnams las khyad par du gyur ba'i bye brag bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain the great wonder and the distinctions that are different from the tīrthikas.

original: ci ste bye brag ma mchis na ni mu stegs can rnams kyang sangs rgyas lags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste bye brag ma mchis na ni mu stegs can rnams kyang sangs rgyas lags par 'gyur te /
translated: If there are no distinctions, then the tīrthikas would also be buddhas,

original: 'di ltar skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis ni 'jig rten kyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po 'byung ba ni gnas med do zhes kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa'i slad du'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis ni 'jig rten kyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po 'byung ba ni gnas med do zhes kyang gsungs la /
translated: because they do not arise and do not cease.🔽The Blessed One has also said that it is impossible for many buddhas to appear in one world system.

original: 'di ltar ji skad bka' stsal ba dang sbyar na ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po 'byug bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji skad bka' stsal ba dang sbyar na ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas mang po 'byug bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, according to what you have said, many buddhas would appear in one world system.

original: bye brag ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bye brag ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because there is no distinction.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la bka' stsal pa /🔽ngas bshad pa'i skye @429a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la bka' stsal pa / ngas bshad pa'i skye @429a *//
translated: The Bhagavān said to Mahāmati:

original: ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: My teaching of non-arising and non-ceasing is not the same as the non-arising and non-ceasing of the tīrthikas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mu stegs can de dag ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pas ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'thob kyi nga ni de ltar yod pa dang / med pa'i phyogs su lhung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can de dag ni dngos po'i rang bzhin yod pas ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'thob kyi nga ni de ltar yod pa dang / med pa'i phyogs su lhung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because those tīrthikas, due to the existence of the intrinsic nature of things, do not attain the characteristic of non-arising and immutability, whereas I do not fall into the position of existence or non-existence.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: nga ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba /
analyzed: nga ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba /
translated: I am free from the positions of existence and non-existence,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from arising and ceasing,

original: dngos po'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po'ang ma yin /
translated: not a thing,

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: not a non-thing,

original: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam gyi gzugs sna tshogs lta bur snang ba'i phyir dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam gyi gzugs sna tshogs lta bur snang ba'i phyir dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: not a non-thing because of appearing like various forms in an illusion and a dream.

original: ji ltar na dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are not things?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid med cing gzung ba rnams snang ba dang mi snang ba'i phyir dang / 'dzin pas yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir des na dngos po thams cad ni dngos po'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid med cing gzung ba rnams snang ba dang mi snang ba'i phyir dang / 'dzin pas yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir des na dngos po thams cad ni dngos po'ang ma yin /
translated: It is like this:

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Because the characteristics of the nature of form do not exist, and because of the appearance and non-appearance of the apprehended, and because of not being grasped by the apprehender, therefore all things are neither things nor not things.

original: 'di ltar rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas rnam par rtog pa mi skye zhing shin tu bde bas 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams rab tu zhi ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas rnam par rtog pa mi skye zhing shin tu bde bas 'jig rten gyi bya ba rnams rab tu zhi ba yin na /
translated: Thus, because of comprehending that they are mere appearances of one’s own mind, conceptual thoughts do not arise, and because of great bliss, worldly activities are pacified.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa rnams bya ba yod par rnam par rtog gi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa rnams bya ba yod par rnam par rtog gi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: However, childish ordinary beings, who are unskilled, conceive of activities as existent, but the noble ones do not.

original: yang dag pa @429b ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa'i skyes bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa @429b ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / sprul pa'i skyes bu lta bu'o //
translated: Unreal conceptual thoughts are like a city of gandharvas, an illusion, or a magically created person.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na / dri za'i grong khyer gyi nang du sgyu ma dang / sprul pa'i skyes bu'i 'dren pa mang po sna tshogs 'byung zhing 'jug pa la /
analyzed: dper na / dri za'i grong khyer gyi nang du sgyu ma dang / sprul pa'i skyes bu'i 'dren pa mang po sna tshogs 'byung zhing 'jug pa la /
translated: in the city of gandharvas, many different kinds of illusory and emanated beings appear and enter.

original: byis pa mi mkhas pa'i rnam par rtog pas bden par 'di dag 'byung ngo //🔽'jug go zhes smra'ang yang dag par 'byung zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: byis pa mi mkhas pa'i rnam par rtog pas bden par 'di dag 'byung ngo // 'jug go zhes smra'ang yang dag par 'byung zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The childish, who are unskilled in conceptualization, say, “These things appear and enter as true.”

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba med de /
translated: But there is no such thing as “appearance” or “entering.”

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is merely conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa rnams skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i nor pa skyed par byed de /🔽de dag la ni 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa rnams skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i nor pa skyed par byed de / de dag la ni 'dus byas sam /
translated: the childish, ordinary beings who are unskilled generate the error of non-arising and non-cessation.🔽For them, there is nothing at all that is conditioned

original: 'dus ma byas gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gang yang med do //
translated: or unconditioned.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar skye'ang yang dag par de la skye ba'am 'gag pa ci'ang med de /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar skye'ang yang dag par de la skye ba'am 'gag pa ci'ang med de /
translated: Although they are born like illusory beings, in reality there is no arising or cessation whatsoever.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gang yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither things nor non-things exist.

original: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin te; skye ba dang 'gag pa spangs pa yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin te; skye ba dang 'gag pa spangs pa yin na /
translated: All phenomena are like this, free from arising and ceasing.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin par lhung bas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung gi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo mi mkhas pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin par lhung bas skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung gi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: However, childish ordinary beings, who are unskilled and fall into what is not real, give rise to the concepts of arising and ceasing.

original: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin brtags pa de bzhin du'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i rang bzhin brtags pa de bzhin du'ang ma yin /
translated: Here, what is called “not real” is the imputed nature of things, which is neither as it is

original: gzhan du'ang ma yin @430a *//
analyzed: gzhan du'ang ma yin @430a *//
translated: nor otherwise.

original: no; ;gal te gzhan du brtags na ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa nyid du 'byung bas rab tu dben pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: no; ;gal te gzhan du brtags na ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa nyid du 'byung bas rab tu dben pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: If it were imputed as otherwise, since the nature of all things would be conceived of as existent, one would not see their seclusion.

original: rab tu dben pa mi mthong na rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa mi mthong na rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not see their seclusion, one will not become free from conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de'i phyir / blo gros chen po /
translated: Therefore, Mahāmati,

original: mtshan ma med pas ni mchog mthong gi /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas ni mchog mthong gi /
translated: the supreme is seen through the absence of signs,

original: mtshan mas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan mas ni ma yin te /
translated: not through signs.

original: mtshan mar mthong ba ni skye ba len pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mchog ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mar mthong ba ni skye ba len pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mchog ma yin no //
translated: Because seeing signs is the cause for taking birth, it is not supreme.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mtshan ma med pa ni rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
translated: signlessness is the non-arising of conceptualization.

original: mi 'byung mi 'gag pas ngas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mi 'byung mi 'gag pas ngas mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Because it does not arise or cease, I have explained it as nirvāṇa.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas sngar rnam par rtog pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams spangs pa /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong bas sngar rnam par rtog pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams spangs pa /
translated: in that regard, nirvāṇa is the prior abandonment of the mind and mental factors that are conceptual thoughts by seeing the meaning of reality just as it is,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes thob pa de ni ngas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes thob pa de ni ngas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: and the attainment of the Tathāgata's noble wisdom of individual self-realization. That I have taught as nirvāṇa.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sa don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sa don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, in order to teach just that meaning, spoke these verses:

original: skye bar smra ba de bzlog phyir //
analyzed: skye bar smra ba de bzlog phyir //
translated: In order to reverse the proponents of arising,

original: mi skye don ni rnam par bzhag /
analyzed: mi skye don ni rnam par bzhag /
translated: The meaning of non-arising is established.

original: nga yis de ltar bshad pa'i chos //
analyzed: nga yis de ltar bshad pa'i chos //
translated: The Dharma that I have explained like this

original: byis pa rnams kyis rig mi nus //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis rig mi nus //
translated: Cannot be understood by the childish.

original: chos rnams thams cad mi skye @430b bas /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mi skye @430b bas /
translated: Since all phenomena are unborn,

original: dngos po med cing skye ba med //
analyzed: dngos po med cing skye ba med //
translated: They are unreal and unarisen.

original: rmi lam sgyu ma dri za'i grong //
analyzed: rmi lam sgyu ma dri za'i grong //
translated: Like dreams, illusions, and castles in the sky,

original: dngos po yod kyang rgyu ni med //
analyzed: dngos po yod kyang rgyu ni med //
translated: Things exist, but they have no causes.🔽Why have I also explained emptiness,

original: ma skyes rang bzhin med pa dang // ci phyir stong pa'ang bshad par bya //
analyzed: ma skyes rang bzhin med pa dang // ci phyir stong pa'ang bshad par bya //
translated: The unborn, and the lack of inherent nature?

original: 'dus pa dag ni yongs spangs shing //
analyzed: 'dus pa dag ni yongs spangs shing //
translated: When the mind is free from the composite,

original: blo gros rig na dngos mi snang //
analyzed: blo gros rig na dngos mi snang //
translated: Things do not appear to the discerning mind.

original: de phyir stong nyid ma skyes pa //
analyzed: de phyir stong nyid ma skyes pa //
translated: Therefore, emptiness is unborn,

original: rang bzhin med par ngas bshad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par ngas bshad do //
translated: And I have explained it to be devoid of inherent nature.

original: 'di ltar re re 'dus pas na //
analyzed: 'di ltar re re 'dus pas na //
translated: In this way, when each of these is combined,

original: dngos po snang yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos po snang yang yod ma yin //
translated: Things appear, but they do not exist.

original: rnam par gzhigs na 'dus pa med //
analyzed: rnam par gzhigs na 'dus pa med //
translated: When analyzed, there is no composite,

original: mu stegs lta ba ltar yang min //
analyzed: mu stegs lta ba ltar yang min //
translated: Nor is it like the views of the tīrthikas.🔽Like dreams, illusions, floating hairs,

original: rmi lam sgyu ma skra shad dang // smig rgyu dri za'i grong khyer ltar //
analyzed: rmi lam sgyu ma skra shad dang // smig rgyu dri za'i grong khyer ltar //
translated: And mirages,

original: 'jig rten dngos po sna tshogs kun //
analyzed: 'jig rten dngos po sna tshogs kun //
translated: All the various things of the world

original: rgyu med mtshan nyid rab tu snang //
analyzed: rgyu med mtshan nyid rab tu snang //
translated: Clearly appear without causes.

original: rgyu yod smra ba gdul ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu yod smra ba gdul ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to guide those who speak of the existence of causes,

original: ma skyes don ni rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: ma skyes don ni rab tu bsgrags //
translated: The meaning of non-arising is proclaimed.🔽By proclaiming non-arising,

original: skye med rab tu bsgrags pas na; ;chos kyi tshul ni rgyun mi 'chad //
analyzed: skye med rab tu bsgrags pas na; ;chos kyi tshul ni rgyun mi 'chad //
translated: The way of the Dharma is uninterrupted.

original: rgyu med rab tu smra ba ni //
analyzed: rgyu med rab tu smra ba ni //
translated: Those who speak of causelessness

original: 'jigs pa'i mu stegs can rnams te //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i mu stegs can rnams te //
translated: Are fearful tīrthikas.

original: ji ltar ci yi phyir na ni //
analyzed: ji ltar ci yi phyir na ni //
translated: How and why

original: de yang ci phyir skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang ci phyir skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Do they arise?

original: gang dag tu ni 'dus gyur na //
analyzed: gang dag tu ni 'dus gyur na //
translated: Where do they gather

original: rgyu med par ni smra bar byed //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni smra bar byed //
translated: To speak of causelessness?

original: 'dus byas chos rnams rab btags na //
analyzed: 'dus byas chos rnams rab btags na //
translated: Having designated conditioned phenomena,

original: rgyu med rgyu yod ma yin te //
analyzed: rgyu med rgyu yod ma yin te //
translated: They are neither causeless nor caused.

original: skye dang 'jig par smra ba yi //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig par smra ba yi //
translated: Those who speak of arising and ceasing

original: lta ba dag ni de nas ldog /
analyzed: lta ba dag ni de nas ldog /
translated: Then abandon views.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos tshigs su bcad de zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos tshigs su bcad de zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati asked in verse:

original: ci yi slad du skye ma mchis //
analyzed: ci yi slad du skye ma mchis //
translated: Why is there no arising?

original: 'on te dngos po ma mchis sam //🔽de ste rkyen @431a *//
analyzed: 'on te dngos po ma mchis sam // de ste rkyen @431a *//
translated: Is it because things do not exist,

original: la btags pa'am //
analyzed: la btags pa'am //
translated: Or is it because they are imputed to conditions,

original: chos mchis mi skye zhes bgyi'am //
analyzed: chos mchis mi skye zhes bgyi'am //
translated: Or is it that existent phenomena do not arise?

original: ming ni don ma mchis mi rigs //
analyzed: ming ni don ma mchis mi rigs //
translated: It is not reasonable for a name to be meaningless.

original: rnam par dbye zhing bshad du gsol //
analyzed: rnam par dbye zhing bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain and analyze them.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke in verse:

original: dngos med mi skye ma yin te //
analyzed: dngos med mi skye ma yin te //
translated: “It is not non-arising,

original: rkyen la btags pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen la btags pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it imputed in conditions.

original: dngos po yod pas ming yod min //
analyzed: dngos po yod pas ming yod min //
translated: Because of the existence of things, names exist,

original: ming la don med pa yang min //
analyzed: ming la don med pa yang min //
translated: But names do not exist without meaning.🔽It is not the domain of all tīrthikas,

original: mu stegs can ni thams cad dang // nyan thos dang ni rang rgyal dang // sa bdun spyod yul ma yin pa //
analyzed: mu stegs can ni thams cad dang // nyan thos dang ni rang rgyal dang // sa bdun spyod yul ma yin pa //
translated: Śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or those on the seven grounds.

original: de ni mi skye mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mi skye mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of non-arising.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams yongs spangs shing //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams yongs spangs shing //
translated: Completely abandoning causes and conditions,

original: bya ba thams cad yongs bral te //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad yongs bral te //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: mi rtag pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'jig go /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: ji ltar dbyug pa dang / gyo mo dang / rdo bas dngos po dag bcom par byed pa bzhin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni rgyu yod de /

analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin no //
