analyzed: dngos po thams cad byed pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid du lhung na ni mi rtag pa bdag nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If all things fell into the characteristic of the nature of the cause of action, impermanence would itself be impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa nyid mi rtag pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid mi rtag pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because impermanence itself is impermanent, all things would not be impermanent.

original: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be permanent.

original: gal te mi rtag pa dngos po thams cad kyi nang du song ba yin na ni dus gsum du lhung bar 'gyur te /🔽gang 'das pa'i @434a *//
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa dngos po thams cad kyi nang du song ba yin na ni dus gsum du lhung bar 'gyur te / gang 'das pa'i @434a *//
translated: If impermanence were included among all things, it would fall into the three times.🔽That form of the past

original: gzugs de ni zhig pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs de ni zhig pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: is associated with disintegration.

original: gang ma 'ongs pa ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: That of the future is unarisen,

original: gzugs ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form has not yet arisen.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The form of the present is associated with the characteristic of disintegration.

original: de la gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams bsags pa'i bye brag go /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams bsags pa'i bye brag go /
translated: In this regard, form is a particular aggregation of the great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mi 'jig ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyi rang bzhin ni mi 'jig ste /
translated: The nature of the great elements and the form derived from the elements is indestructible,

original: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes mu stegs can thams cad 'byung ba chen po rnams mi 'jig par rtog go /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes mu stegs can thams cad 'byung ba chen po rnams mi 'jig par rtog go /
translated: because it is neither different nor not different. Thus, all tīrthikas conceive the great elements to be indestructible.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: srid pa gsum po thams cad 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gnas pa rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa yod par shes na /
analyzed: srid pa gsum po thams cad 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs gnas pa rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa yod par shes na /
translated: All the three worlds, which are forms that are elements and forms derived from elements, are known to have arising and destruction.

original: 'byung ba chen po dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs las logs shig na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs las logs shig na /
translated: Apart from the great elements and forms derived from the great elements,

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis gang la bsams nas mi rtag pa zhes rtog ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis gang la bsams nas mi rtag pa zhes rtog ste /
translated: what is it that the tīrthikas imagine and think of as impermanent?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi skye ba dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi skye ba dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the four great elements do not arise and their intrinsic characteristics do not perish.

original: de la dang po rtsom pa yongs su spangs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'ang ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang tha dad pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / so so tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de la dang po rtsom pa yongs su spangs pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'ang ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang tha dad pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / so so tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: “Impermanence that completely abandons initial composition” means that the four great elements are not the four great elements, and the four great elements are not different from each other.🔽The characteristics of each are different,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and they have their own characteristics.

original: bye brag mi dmigs pa dang / de'i bye brag @434b med pa dang / de la sogs pas yang mi rtsom pa dang / sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis pa mi rtsom pa ni mi rtag pa nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag mi dmigs pa dang / de'i bye brag @434b med pa dang / de la sogs pas yang mi rtsom pa dang / sbyor ba rnam pa gnyis pa mi rtsom pa ni mi rtag pa nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand impermanence through such things as not beginning again and not beginning a second application.

original: de la dbyibs rnam par 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dbyibs rnam par 'jig pa'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among those, impermanence that destroys shape is as follows:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi mi 'jig pa ni mthar phyin pa'i bar du mi 'jig go zhes zer la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams kyi mi 'jig pa ni mthar phyin pa'i bar du mi 'jig go zhes zer la /
translated: Some say, “The non-destruction of the four great elements and the derivative forms is non-destruction until the end is reached.”

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mthar phyin pa ni rdul phra mo'i bar du rab tu phye ste /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni rdul phra mo'i bar du rab tu phye ste /
translated: the end is reached by dividing into subtle particles.

original: 'jig pa las so sor brtags na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams tha dad par mthong ba'i dbyibs dang ring thung mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'jig pa las so sor brtags na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams tha dad par mthong ba'i dbyibs dang ring thung mi dmigs te /
translated: When one examines destruction individually, one sees the difference between the four great elements and derivative forms, and shape and length are not observed.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni ma yin pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi 'jig gi /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni ma yin pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi mi 'jig gi /
translated: Since the four great elements are not so, the four great elements are not destroyed.

original: dbyibs rnam par 'jig pa lta bas grangs can gyi smra bar ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs rnam par 'jig pa lta bas grangs can gyi smra bar ltung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the assertion that the shape of the primary elements is impermanent is a descent into the theory of the Sāṃkhyas.

original: de la gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, the statement “form itself is impermanent” means the following.

original: gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin pas dbyibs de dag mi rtag pa nyid de /🔽'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs nyid mi rtag pa nyid yin pas dbyibs de dag mi rtag pa nyid de / 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Since form itself is impermanent, those shapes are impermanent, but the primary elements are not.

original: gal te 'byung ba bzhi po rnams mi rtag pa nyid yin na ni 'jig rten gyi grangs su brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba bzhi po rnams mi rtag pa nyid yin na ni 'jig rten gyi grangs su brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the four primary elements were impermanent, they would not be described in the enumeration of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi brjod pa'i dngos po med na ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i lta bar ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽dngos po thams cad brjod pa'i tshig tsam du mthong zhing rang gi mtshan nyid skye bar mi @435a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi brjod pa'i dngos po med na ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i lta bar ltung bar 'gyur te / dngos po thams cad brjod pa'i tshig tsam du mthong zhing rang gi mtshan nyid skye bar mi @435a *//
translated: If they were not things described in the world, then one would fall into the view of the Lokāyatas.

original: mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one would see all things as mere words of description and not see the arising of their own characteristics.

original: de la rnam par 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs dngos po gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba ste /
translated: In this regard, the statement “impermanence is a transformation” means that form is seen to transform into another thing.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: But the great elements are not.

original: ji ltar gser las rgyan du byas pa rnams 'gyur bar snang yang gser gyi rang bzhin 'jig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar gser las rgyan du byas pa rnams 'gyur bar snang yang gser gyi rang bzhin 'jig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as ornaments made of gold appear to change, but the nature of the gold is not destroyed,🔽and the shape of the ornaments is destroyed, so it is with the transformation of other things.

original: rgyan gyi dbyibs la 'jig pa yod pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'ang de bzhin no zhes de la sogs pa'i rnam pas mu stegs can rnams mi rtag pa'i lta bar rnam par rtog go /
analyzed: rgyan gyi dbyibs la 'jig pa yod pa de bzhin du dngos po gzhan rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'ang de bzhin no zhes de la sogs pa'i rnam pas mu stegs can rnams mi rtag pa'i lta bar rnam par rtog go /
translated: In this and other ways, the tīrthikas imagine the view of impermanence.

original: 'di ltar mes 'byung ba chen po rnams bsregs pa'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid la ni mi sreg go /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes 'byung ba chen po rnams bsregs pa'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid la ni mi sreg go /
translated: When the great elements are burned by fire, their specific characteristics are not burned.

original: ci ste so so nas rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gis gcig 'jig par byed na ni 'byung ba dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste so so nas rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gis gcig 'jig par byed na ni 'byung ba dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If each specific characteristic were to destroy the other, it would be logical that the forms derived from the elements would be interrupted.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: nga'i chos ni byung ba nyid na rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: nga'i chos ni byung ba nyid na rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: my teaching is that when things arise, they are neither permanent

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po ma nges pa'i phyir srid pa gsum sems tsam du bstan gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po ma nges pa'i phyir srid pa gsum sems tsam du bstan gyi /
translated: The three existences are taught to be mind only because external things are uncertain.

original: mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa yod par ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa yod par ni ma bstan to //
translated: But it is not taught that the existence of various characteristics, arising, and destruction do not exist.🔽The two kinds of things, the apprehended and the apprehender, arise from the specific combinations of the great elements and from the elements and the derivative forms.

original: 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa'i bye brag dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir rnam @435b pa gnyis kyi dngos po gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa gnyis yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa'i bye brag dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir rnam @435b pa gnyis kyi dngos po gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rtog pa gnyis yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: The two kinds of conceptual thoughts arise from the conditioning of conceptual thought.🔽The two views of external things and nonthings are absent.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba gnyis dang bral ba dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa'i bsams pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las skye'i /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba gnyis dang bral ba dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa'i bsams pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa las skye'i /
translated: One understands that things are mere appearances of one’s own mind.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni ma yin no zhes sems dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi chos thams cad ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni ma yin no zhes sems dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas na 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi chos thams cad ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Since the mind is free from the conceptualization of things and nonthings, all phenomena—mundane, supramundane, and the supreme of what transcends the mundane—are neither permanent

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor impermanent.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas mtha' gnyis kyi lta ba ngan pa'i rgyun du lhung bar 'gyur te; mu stegs can thams cad kyis rang gi rnam par rtog pa khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas mtha' gnyis kyi lta ba ngan pa'i rgyun du lhung bar 'gyur te; mu stegs can thams cad kyis rang gi rnam par rtog pa khong du mi chud do //
translated: “Because they have not understood that things are mere appearances of their own mind, they fall into the continuous bad views of the two extremes.🔽All tīrthikas do not understand their own conceptual thoughts.

original: so so'i skye bo de dag la gzhi ci'ang med pas 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi chos tshig gi rnam par rtog pa las skye bar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du chud pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo de dag la gzhi ci'ang med pas 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi chos tshig gi rnam par rtog pa las skye bar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du chud pa ma yin no //
translated: “Because those ordinary beings have no basis, they do not understand that mundane, supramundane, and supreme phenomena arise from the conceptualization of words.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavat, in order to teach just this meaning, spoke these verses:

original: dang po brtsams nas rab spangs shing //🔽dbyibs dang rnam pa gzhan 'gyur dang // @436a *//
analyzed: dang po brtsams nas rab spangs shing // dbyibs dang rnam pa gzhan 'gyur dang // @436a *//
translated: “Having abandoned the first beginning,

original: dngos po gzugs ni mi rtag pa //
analyzed: dngos po gzugs ni mi rtag pa //
translated: The form of things is impermanent,🔽And is transformed into another shape.

original: mu stegs blun pos rtog par byed //
analyzed: mu stegs blun pos rtog par byed //
translated: The foolish tīrthikas imagine it.

original: dngos po rnams la 'jig pa med //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la 'jig pa med //
translated: Things do not perish.

original: 'byung ba 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gnas //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gnas //
translated: The arising of the elements abides in the nature of the elements.

original: mu stegs mi rtag 'du shes pa //
analyzed: mu stegs mi rtag 'du shes pa //
translated: The tīrthikas, perceiving impermanence,

original: lta ba sna tshogs bying bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lta ba sna tshogs bying bar 'gyur //
translated: Sink into various views.

original: mu stegs can ni de dag la //
analyzed: mu stegs can ni de dag la //
translated: In those tīrthikas,

original: skye dang 'jig pa gang yang med //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa gang yang med //
translated: There is neither arising nor perishing.

original: 'byung ba 'byung ba'i rang bzhin rtag /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'byung ba'i rang bzhin rtag /
translated: The arising of the elements is permanent.

original: ji skad mi rtag nyid du rtog /
analyzed: ji skad mi rtag nyid du rtog /
translated: How is it imagined to be impermanent?

original: thams cad sems tsam snang ba ste //
analyzed: thams cad sems tsam snang ba ste //
translated: Everything is mind only, an appearance.

original: rnam pa gnyis su sems kyang 'jug /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su sems kyang 'jug /
translated: The mind also engages in two aspects:

original: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The apprehended and the apprehender.

original: bdag dang bdag gi yod ma yin //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi yod ma yin //
translated: The self and ‘mine’ do not exist.

original: tshangs pa sdong po rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: tshangs pa sdong po rtsa ba yin //
translated: Brahmā is the root of the trunk.

original: yal ga lo ma kun tu khyab //
analyzed: yal ga lo ma kun tu khyab //
translated: And the branches and leaves spread out.

original: 'di skad du ni ngas bshad de //
analyzed: 'di skad du ni ngas bshad de //
translated: I explain it like this:

original: de dag gi ni sems tsam yin //
analyzed: de dag gi ni sems tsam yin //
translated: They are only mind.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva Mahāmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain the characteristics of the sequence of entry into the absorption of cessation for all bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gal te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par gyur na /
translated: If one becomes skilled in the characteristics of the sequence of entry into the absorption of cessation,

original: bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i sgo spong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i sgo spong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: I and other bodhisattvas will not abandon the gateway to the bliss of the absorption of cessation,

original: @436b nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi rmongs par ltung bar mi 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: @436b nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can gyi rmongs par ltung bar mi 'gyur lags so //
translated: and will not fall into the delusion of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tīrthikas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: shin tu legs bar nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu legs bar nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: listen well and keep in mind what I say, and I will explain it to you.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Mahāmati said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽please explain.

original: bshad du gsol zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bshad du gsol zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sa drug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis snyoms par 'jug pas skyed par byed la /
analyzed: sa drug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis snyoms par 'jug pas skyed par byed la /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas on the sixth ground, the śrāvakas, and the pratyekabuddhas generate it through meditative equipoise.

original: sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni sems kyi skad cig re re la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni sems kyi skad cig re re la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas on the seventh ground enter meditative equipoise in every moment of thought.

original: dngos po thams cad kyis rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pas snyoms par 'jug gi /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyis rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pas snyoms par 'jug gi /
translated: They enter meditative equipoise by completely abandoning the characteristics of the nature of all things.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i blo can gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i blo can gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung bas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas enter the absorption of cessation with a mind that is conditioned, having fallen into the characteristics of subject and object.

original: de bas na sa bdun pa ni yid la byed pas snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sa bdun pa ni yid la byed pas snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the seventh ground is not an absorption through mental activity.

original: chos thams cad bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid thob pas rim gyis mtshan nyid kyi dngos po sna tshogs thob pa ni ma @437a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid thob pas rim gyis mtshan nyid kyi dngos po sna tshogs thob pa ni ma @437a *//
translated: Because they have attained the characteristic of the non-differentiation of all phenomena, they do not gradually attain the various characterized things.

original: yin no // dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud de /
analyzed: yin no // dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud de /
translated: They have comprehended the characteristics of all virtuous and non-virtuous phenomena.

original: snyoms par 'jug pas de'i phyir sa bdun pa la dge ba'i sems kyis snyoms par 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pas de'i phyir sa bdun pa la dge ba'i sems kyis snyoms par 'jug pa med do //
translated: Therefore, on the seventh ground there is no absorption through a virtuous mind.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'du shes ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'du shes ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The thoughts, minds, and mental consciousnesses of the bodhisattvas on the eighth ground, as well as those of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, will cease to conceptualize and discriminate.

original: sa dang po nas sa bdun pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' de dag khams gsum pa 'di ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes so sor rab tu rtog ste /
analyzed: sa dang po nas sa bdun pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' de dag khams gsum pa 'di ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes so sor rab tu rtog ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the first to seventh grounds will individually realize that this three-realm world is merely mind, mentality, and mental consciousness.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba /
translated: It is devoid of self and entities connected to the self.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa can /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa can /
translated: It is the domain of one’s own conceptualization.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid du lhung ba /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid du lhung ba /
translated: It is the domain of the various characteristics of external entities.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po rnam pa gnyis su gyur pas mi shes pa'i rjes su song ba /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po rnam pa gnyis su gyur pas mi shes pa'i rjes su song ba /
translated: It is the domain of the two types of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects that are the characteristics of the various entities of childish ordinary beings.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rnam par spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa  las khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rnam par spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa  las khong du mi chud do //
translated: It is not understood because of the habitual tendencies of the negative propensities of conceptual elaborations since beginningless time.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mya @437b ngan las 'das pa mtshungs kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin blos yongs su bzung bas /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mya @437b ngan las 'das pa mtshungs kyang byang chub sems dpa' ni ting nge 'dzin blos yongs su bzung bas /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas on the eighth ground, the śrāvakas, and the pratyekabuddhas are alike in attaining nirvāṇa, but the bodhisattvas, due to the power of their previous aspirations, do not enter the peace of nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i bde bas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i bde bas yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, because they are sustained by the bliss of samādhi, they do not attain nirvāṇa.

original: gal te yongs su ma bzung du zin na ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhing sems can gyi bya ba thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yongs su ma bzung du zin na ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur zhing sems can gyi bya ba thams cad yongs su spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: If they were not sustained, they would not complete the ground of the tathāgatas and would abandon all activities for sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi gdung yang chad par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi gdung yang chad par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And the lineage of the tathāgatas would be broken.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa ston to //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, reveal the inconceivable, immeasurable good qualities of the Tathagatas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i bde bas phrogs par gyur pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i bde bas phrogs par gyur pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes so //
translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, because they are carried away by the bliss of the door of samadhi, think that they have attained Nirvana.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: ngas sa bdun pa'i sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing goms par bya ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / gang zag dang / chos bdag med pa bsdu ba dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: ngas sa bdun pa'i sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing goms par bya ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa dang / gang zag dang / chos bdag med pa bsdu ba dang / skye ba dang /
translated: I have taught you the characteristics of the mind, the mental organ, and the mental consciousness on the seventh stage, and you should become familiar with them, as well as the inclusion of the grasping of I and mine, the selflessness of persons and things, and the arising of the three kinds of non-arising.

original: 'jig pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing goms par bya ba dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnam par gdon mi za ba'i stobs la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / sa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang / rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas shing goms par bya ba dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi rnam par gdon mi za ba'i stobs la mkhas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / sa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang /
translated: the destruction of the afflictions, the expertise and familiarization with the characteristics of the individual and general, the expertise in the four correct discriminations and the power of certainty, the door of meditative concentration, the connection of the sequence of the stages,

original: byang @438a *// chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnam par dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang @438a *// chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnam par dbye bar bya'o //
translated: and the classification of the factors of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes shing sa bdun la mi mkhas pa dang / mu stegs can gyi log pa'i lam du lhung bar mi bya ba'i phyir sa'i go rims kyis rnam par bzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes shing sa bdun la mi mkhas pa dang / mu stegs can gyi log pa'i lam du lhung bar mi bya ba'i phyir sa'i go rims kyis rnam par bzhag pa yin te /
translated: The sequence of the stages is presented in order to prevent bodhisattva mahāsattvas from falling into the wrong paths of the tīrthikas due to not knowing the individual and general characteristics and not being skilled in the seven stages.

original: blo gros chen po /🔽'di la yang dag par gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / 'di la yang dag par gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: Mahāmati,🔽in this [system], there is no such thing as the arising or

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: destruction of anything real.

original: gzhan du na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di lta ste /
translated: Otherwise, it is like this:

original: sa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang / khams gsum sna tshogs kyi spyod pa 'di ni sems snang ba tsam ste /🔽byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: sa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang / khams gsum sna tshogs kyi spyod pa 'di ni sems snang ba tsam ste / byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
translated: The connection to the stages of the earth and the conduct of the various three realms is merely the appearance of mind.🔽The childish, ordinary beings do not understand.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud pas 'di lta ste /
translated: The childish, ordinary beings do not understand.

original: nga dang sangs rgyas de dag gis sa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang / khams gsum gyi spyod pa sna tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: nga dang sangs rgyas de dag gis sa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang / khams gsum gyi spyod pa sna tshogs bstan to //
translated: Therefore, I and those buddhas have explained the connection to the stages of the earth and the conduct of the various three realms.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: “Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i myos pas myos te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba'i myos pas myos te /
translated: the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, intoxicated by the bliss of the meditative absorption of cessation on the eighth bodhisattva stage,

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam la mi mkhas pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba /
translated: are unskilled in the mere appearance of their own minds, and they fall into the characteristics of the individual and general.

original: bag chags kyis bsgribs pa /
analyzed: bag chags kyis bsgribs pa /
translated: They are obscured by traces.

original: gang zag dang chos bdag med par lhung ba chos su 'dzin par lta ba /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos bdag med par lhung ba chos su 'dzin par lta ba /
translated: They fall into the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and they view the grasping of phenomena.

original: rnam par rtog @438b pas mya ngan las 'das par rab tu shes par gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog @438b pas mya ngan las 'das par rab tu shes par gyur te /
translated: They understand nirvāṇa through conceptualization,

original: rab tu dben pa la mos pa'i blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa la mos pa'i blo ni ma yin no //
translated: but they do not have the mind that is devoted to solitude.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgo'i bde ba mthong yang sngon gyi smon lam dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan zhing mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu rnam par dbye ba shes pas rnam par rtog pas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sgo'i bde ba mthong yang sngon gyi smon lam dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po dang ldan zhing mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu rnam par dbye ba shes pas rnam par rtog pas mya ngan las 'das par 'du shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: bodhisattvas see the happiness of the gate but, due to their previous aspirations, their compassion, and their great compassion, and due to their knowledge of the classification of the ten ultimate abodes, they do not conceive of nirvāṇa through conceptualization.

original: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because the conceptualization of nirvāṇa does not arise,

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spong zhing chos thams cad rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su spong zhing chos thams cad rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pas rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
translated: they abandon the conceptualization of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects and, because they understand that all phenomena are merely appearances of their own minds, conceptualization does not arise.

original: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog par yang mi ltung la /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog par yang mi ltung la /
translated: They do not fall into the conceptualization that is attached to the characteristics of the nature of mind, thought, and consciousness, or to the nature of external things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyu mi skyed pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyu mi skyed pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: And yet they do not fail to produce the causes of the buddhadharmas.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su skye bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gis rig pa'i sa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su skye bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gis rig pa'i sa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they are born from wisdom, they attain the stage of the Tathāgata’s own realization.

original: ji ltar skyes bu'i rmi lam na chu bo rgal bar rtsom pa pha rol tu ma phyin par sad la /🔽sang  nas 'di snyam du ci 'di yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu'i rmi lam na chu bo rgal bar rtsom pa pha rol tu ma phyin par sad la / sang  nas 'di snyam du ci 'di yang dag pa'am /
translated: “It is like a person who, in a dream, tries to cross a river but has not reached the other side when he wakes up.🔽The next day he thinks, ‘Was that real?

original: 'on te yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes rtog par byed pa de ni yang dag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes rtog par byed pa de ni yang dag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Or was it not real?’ It is neither real nor unreal.

original: log pa'ang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: log pa'ang ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not something else.

original: gzhan du na thog ma med pa'i mthong ba dang / thos pa @439a *//
analyzed: gzhan du na thog ma med pa'i mthong ba dang / thos pa @439a *//
translated: It is not something seen or heard that has no beginning.

original: dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa rgyu'i 'du shes sna tshogs kyi bag chags dang / dbyibs dang / gnas sna tshogs dang / yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba dang / sems dang / yid dang /
analyzed: dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa rgyu'i 'du shes sna tshogs kyi bag chags dang / dbyibs dang / gnas sna tshogs dang / yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba dang / sems dang / yid dang /
translated: and the various types of consciousness, the various habitual tendencies of the various notions of causes, shapes, various locations, and falling into the characteristics of existence and nonexistence, the mind, the mental faculty,

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rmi lam las snang ngo //
translated: and the mental consciousness appear in a dream.

original: blo gros chen po /🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid skye bar mthong ba dang / sa dang po nas brtsal bas sa bdun du 'pho ba dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mthong ba'i sbyor bas gzung ba dang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid skye bar mthong ba dang / sa dang po nas brtsal bas sa bdun du 'pho ba dang / chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mthong ba'i sbyor bas gzung ba dang /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'dzin pa'i sems rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa las 'das te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sems rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa las 'das te /
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas see the characteristics of conceptualization arising on the eighth bodhisattva stage, and by investigating from the first stage, they transcend the activities of the conceptual mind that apprehends and apprehends objects on the seven stages, seeing all phenomena as being like illusions and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sbyor ba byas nas da dung ma thob pa ni thob par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sbyor ba byas nas da dung ma thob pa ni thob par byed do //
translated: Having applied himself to the Buddha-dharmas, he causes what has not yet been obtained to be obtained.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i sbyor ba rnam par mi 'jig pa yin te /
translated: this is the bodhisattvas’ application to nirvāṇa, which is not subject to destruction.

analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su spangs nas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned mind, mentation, and mental consciousness, he attains forbearance with respect to dharmas that are unborn.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: don dam pa la ni go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba med de /
analyzed: don dam pa la ni go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba med de /
translated: in the ultimate, there is no sequence or connection,

analyzed: snang ba med pa rnam par rtog pa las dben pa'i chos bstan pa'o //

analyzed: dang po pa ni brgyad pa yin // dgu pa yang ni bdun pa ste //
translated: The first is the eighth.🔽The ninth is also the seventh.

original: bdun pa de yang brgyad pa yin //
analyzed: bdun pa de yang brgyad pa yin //
translated: The seventh is also the eighth.

original: gnyis pa de ni gsum pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis pa de ni gsum pa yin //
translated: The second is the third,

original: bzhi pa yang ni lnga pa yin //
analyzed: bzhi pa yang ni lnga pa yin //
translated: The fourth is also the fifth,

original: gsum pa yang ni drug yin te //
analyzed: gsum pa yang ni drug yin te //
translated: The third is also the sixth,

original: snang ba med la rim ci yod ////
analyzed: snang ba med la rim ci yod ////
translated: What sequence is there in the absence of appearances?

original: 'phags pa langkar gshegs pa rin po che'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa langkar gshegs pa rin po che'i mdo las /
translated: From the noble Lankavatara-ratna-sutra,

original: bam po brgyad pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa ste tha ma /
translated: The eighth and final chapter.

original: de nas @440a *//
analyzed: de nas @440a *//
translated: Then,

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: the bodhisattva Mahamati said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rtag pa zhig gam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rtag pa zhig gam /
translated: is the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, permanent,

original: 'on te mi rtag pa zhig lags /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa zhig lags /
translated: or is he impermanent?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is neither permanent

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: nor impermanent,

original: 'di ltar gnyis ka'ang nyes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis ka'ang nyes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both have faults.

original: gal te rtag par gyur na ni byed pa'i bdag po yod pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rtag par gyur na ni byed pa'i bdag po yod pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //

original: mu stegs can dag rtag pa ni byed pa pos byas pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag rtag pa ni byed pa pos byas pa ma yin pa'o zhes zer te /
