original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag kyang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag kyang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is permanent and also not permanent.

original: byas pa ma yin pa rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pa rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fault of permanence that is not created.

original: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa yin na ni byas pa yod pa'i mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa yin na ni byas pa yod pa'i mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: If the Tathāgata were impermanent, the fault of impermanence that exists in created things would ensue.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid gyi gzhi'i dngos po med pas phung po zhig pa ltar chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid gyi gzhi'i dngos po med pas phung po zhig pa ltar chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: Because of the nonexistence of the characteristics of the aggregates and the basis of characteristics, it would be logical that he would be annihilated, just as the aggregates are destroyed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the Tathāgata is not annihilated.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byas pa thams cad mi rtag na ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad kyang mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: byas pa thams cad mi rtag na ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad kyang mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas /
translated: if all created things were impermanent, the fault of impermanence would ensue for all, just like a vase, a cloth, and so on.

original: thams cad @440b mkhyen pa'i tshogs dang / sbyor ba rnams don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad @440b mkhyen pa'i tshogs dang / sbyor ba rnams don med par 'gyur te /
translated: The accumulations of omniscience and the practices would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that.

original: byas pa thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byas pa thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And all those who have done so would be thus-gone ones,

original: bye brag gi rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag gi rgyu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no basis for a specific cause.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, the thus-gone one is not permanent,

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is he impermanent.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nam mkha' ltar rtag pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nam mkha' ltar rtag pa ma yin te //
translated: the thus-gone one is not permanent like space.

original: nam mkha' ltar rtag pa yin na ni so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs rnams don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rtag pa yin na ni so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs rnams don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were permanent like space, the accumulations of the noble wisdom of individual knowledge would be pointless.🔽Mahāmati,

original: blo gros chen po; dper na /🔽nam mkha' ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po; dper na / nam mkha' ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: for example,🔽space is not permanent

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: nor is it impermanent.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because of the faults of permanence, impermanence, sameness, difference, both, and neither, and permanence and impermanence, it is inexpressible.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is not permanent.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med pa'i rtag pa yin na ni ri bong dang rta la sogs pa'i rva dang mtshungs shing skye ba med pa'i rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med pa'i rtag pa yin na ni ri bong dang rta la sogs pa'i rva dang mtshungs shing skye ba med pa'i rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: if the Tathāgata were permanent as non-arising, he would be the same as the horns of a rabbit, a horse, and so forth, and would be permanent as non-arising.

original: bsgrubs pa rnams don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgrubs pa rnams don med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the practices would be meaningless.

original: skye ba med pa'i rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Because of the fault of permanent non-arising,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata is not permanent.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /🔽dngos po gzhan gyis de bzhin @441a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po / dngos po gzhan gyis de bzhin @441a *//
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: gshegs pa rtag pa yin par shes par 'gyur ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: gshegs pa rtag pa yin par shes par 'gyur ba'ang yod do //
translated: there is also the understanding that the Tathāgata is permanent through being different from things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bar chad med pas mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pas mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes rtag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'o //
translated: Because the wisdom of realization without interruption is permanent, the Tathāgata is permanent.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
translated: whether the Tathāgata appears in the world

original: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung /
translated: or does not appear in the world,

original: chos nyid ni nges par gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos nyid ni nges par gnas pa nyid de /
translated: the nature of reality definitely abides.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bar chad med pa'i gnas pa ni nam mkha' la mi gnas te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bar chad med pa'i gnas pa ni nam mkha' la mi gnas te /
translated: The uninterrupted abiding of the hearers, solitary buddhas, and tathāgatas does not abide in space,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du chud par bya ba'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du chud par bya ba'ang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not something to be understood by ordinary, foolish beings.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa yin gyi; blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs su chud pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyis yongs su bsgos pa yin gyi; blo gros chen po /
translated: the wisdom realized by the tathāgatas is thoroughly imbued with wisdom. Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched de dag gis yongs su bsgos pa ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not imbued with mind, mentation, and consciousness, nor with the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: srid pa gsum po thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: srid pa gsum po thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: the three existences arise from unreal conceptualization,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: but the Tathāgatas do not arise from unreal conceptualization.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos gnyis yod par gyur pa'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa yod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos gnyis yod par gyur pa'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa yod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: because two dharmas exist, permanence and impermanence exist,

original: gnyis su med pa la ni ma @441b yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la ni ma @441b yin no //
translated: but not in the non-dual.

original: gnyis su med pa ni rab tu dben pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni rab tu dben pa'o //
translated: The non-dual is secluded.

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa dang / ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med pa dang / ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all dharmas have the characteristic of non-duality and non-arising,

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are not permanent,

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not impermanent.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ji tsam du tshig gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de tsam du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ji tsam du tshig gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de tsam du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i nyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: to the extent that the conceptualization of words engages, to that extent there is the fault of permanence and impermanence.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo zad par 'gyur na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag par lta ba rab tu ma zhi ba yongs su spong bar 'gyur bas blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo zad par 'gyur na ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag par lta ba rab tu ma zhi ba yongs su spong bar 'gyur bas blo dang ldan pa rnams kyis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang /
translated: But when the conceptual mind is exhausted, the view of permanence and impermanence is completely abandoned by foolish ordinary beings. Therefore, the wise should completely abandon the impregnations of permanence, impermanence,

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'ang ma yin pa'i yongs su bsgos pa rnams shin tu spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'ang ma yin pa'i yongs su bsgos pa rnams shin tu spang bar bya'o //
translated: and neither permanence nor impermanence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, the Blessed One, in order to teach just that meaning, spoke these verses:

original: tshogs rnams don med gyur na ni //
analyzed: tshogs rnams don med gyur na ni //
translated: If the collections were meaningless,

original: rtag dang mi rtag nyes pa skye //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag nyes pa skye //
translated: The faults of permanence and impermanence arise.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo med na //🔽rtag dang mi rtag rab tu spong //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo med na // rtag dang mi rtag rab tu spong //
translated: When the conceptual mind does not exist,

original: dam ni rab tu 'cha' ba las //
analyzed: dam ni rab tu 'cha' ba las //
translated: Permanence and impermanence are completely abandoned.🔽From the establishment of the pledge,

original: gud na 'dres pa'i don yod gyur //
analyzed: gud na 'dres pa'i don yod gyur //
translated: The meaning of the mixture exists elsewhere.

original: rang sems tsam du mnyam rtog na //
analyzed: rang sems tsam du mnyam rtog na //
translated: When one realizes the equality of mere mind,

original: tshig gi brjod pa dmigs su med //
analyzed: tshig gi brjod pa dmigs su med //
translated: The expression of words is not observed.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis yang bdag la phung po dang / khams dang / skye @442a *//
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis yang bdag la phung po dang / khams dang / skye @442a *//
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati again requested the Bhagavān,

original: mched rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa bshad du gsol /
analyzed: mched rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa bshad du gsol /
translated: “Bhagavān, please explain to me the arising and ceasing of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de dag la ni bdag ma mchis na su zhig skye zhing su zhig ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la ni bdag ma mchis na su zhig skye zhing su zhig ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Since they have no self, who arises and who ceases?

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la gnas pas sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ba khong du mi chud cing mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu mi rtog lags so //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa la gnas pas sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ba khong du mi chud cing mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu mi rtog lags so //
translated: Since ordinary beings abide in arising and ceasing, they do not understand the exhaustion of suffering and do not realize nirvāṇa.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: legs so // de'i phyir legs par nyon cig dang khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: legs so // de'i phyir legs par nyon cig dang khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Excellent! Therefore, listen well and I will explain it to you.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “So be it, I will listen” and the Blessed One said to Mahāmati:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni 'gro ba'i skye ba thams cad du khyab par byed pas gar mkhan bzhin du 'gro ba rnams rnam par 'gyur ba ston par byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni 'gro ba'i skye ba thams cad du khyab par byed pas gar mkhan bzhin du 'gro ba rnams rnam par 'gyur ba ston par byed pa /
translated: The Tathāgata-essence, being the cause of virtue and non-virtue, pervades all the births of beings, and like an actor, it displays the transformations of beings.

original: bdag dang bdag gi spangs pa de khong du ma chud pa'i phyir gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen gyi sbyor ba las skye ba dang / mu stegs can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas byed pa por mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi spangs pa de khong du ma chud pa'i phyir gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen gyi sbyor ba las skye ba dang / mu stegs can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas byed pa por mngon par zhen to //
translated: Because of not understanding the abandonment of self and “mine,” it is produced from the conjunction of the three conditions, and because of not being understood by the tīrthikas, it is conceived as an agent.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rnam par spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rnam par spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The so-called foundation consciousness is completely imbued with the habitual propensities of negative tendencies that have been elaborated since beginningless time.

original: ma rig pa gnas pa'i sa rnam par @442b shes pa bdun dang lhan cig bskyed pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa gnas pa'i sa rnam par @442b shes pa bdun dang lhan cig bskyed pa /
translated: It is the consciousness that is the basis of the abode of ignorance, and it is produced together with the seven consciousnesses.

original: rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du lus rtag tu skyed cing rgyun mi 'chad pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du lus rtag tu skyed cing rgyun mi 'chad pa /
translated: Like waves in the ocean, it constantly produces the body and is uninterrupted.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from the faults of permanence and impermanence.

original: bdag tu smra ba yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba yongs su spangs pa /
translated: It completely abandons the assertion of a self.

original: rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pa /
translated: It is naturally stainless.

original: mthar yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: mthar yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: In the end, it is completely pure.

original: de ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba dang / 'jig pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skye ba dang / 'jig pa yod pa ste /
translated: The other consciousnesses have arising and destruction.

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skad cig bdun dang bcas pa yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa'i rgyus yul rnams kyi dbyibs dang gnas sna tshogs len pa /
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skad cig bdun dang bcas pa yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa'i rgyus yul rnams kyi dbyibs dang gnas sna tshogs len pa /
translated: The mind and mental consciousness, together with the seven, take on various shapes and locations of objects due to the cause of unreal imagination.

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan la mngon par zhen pa /
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan la mngon par zhen pa /
translated: They are attached to names and reasons,

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa /
translated: have not understood the characteristics of the forms that are appearances of their own minds,

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba ma rtogs pas rnam par grol ba'i gnas su phyin par mi 'gyur ba ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi kun nas dkris pa'i 'dod chags skye la 'dod chags skyes nas rgyu dang dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba ma rtogs pas rnam par grol ba'i gnas su phyin par mi 'gyur ba ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi kun nas dkris pa'i 'dod chags skye la 'dod chags skyes nas rgyu dang dmigs par byed de /
translated: and have not realized suffering and happiness. Thus, attachment that is a complete entanglement of names and reasons arises in them. When attachment arises, they take it as a cause and an object.🔽When those faculties of feeling cease, they gradually do not arise.🔽Thus, through their own conceptions, they do not understand suffering and happiness.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po de dag 'gag gas  na rim gyis mi skye'o zhes gzhan du rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pas sdug bsngal dang / bde ba ma shes pas tshor ba dang / 'du shes 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po de dag 'gag gas  na rim gyis mi skye'o zhes gzhan du rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pas sdug bsngal dang / bde ba ma shes pas tshor ba dang / 'du shes 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa /
translated: Having entered into the meditative absorption that stops feeling and discrimination, they attain the fourth concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par grol ba la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i 'du shes su byed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par grol ba la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i 'du shes su byed de /
translated: Yogins and yoginīs who are skilled in true reality and liberation think of liberation.

original: rab @443a *// tu ma spangs shing yongs su ma gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab @443a *// tu ma spangs shing yongs su ma gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The utterly unabandoned and utterly unpurified is called the tathāgatagarbha, the ālaya-consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa bdun ni 'khor bar 'jug cing 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun ni 'khor bar 'jug cing 'gag pa med de /
translated: The seven consciousnesses are engaged in saṃsāra and are unceasing.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rgyu dang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa rnams rab tu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa rnams rab tu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consciousnesses arise from their causes and objects.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa /
translated: They are not the domain of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: bdag med pa ma rtogs pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams skyed pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa ma rtogs pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams skyed pa /
translated: Because they have not realized selflessness, they give rise to the aggregates, elements, and sense sources that are subsumed by specific and general characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po mthong bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po mthong bar gyur pa na /
translated: When the tathāgatagarbha is seen,

original: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / gang zag dang / chos bdag med pa rnams ldog par gyur te; sa'i rim pa'i mtshams sbyor ba khyad par du gyur pas gzhan mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnams kyis bskyod par mi nus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / gang zag dang / chos bdag med pa rnams ldog par gyur te; sa'i rim pa'i mtshams sbyor ba khyad par du gyur pas gzhan mu stegs can gyi lta ba rnams kyis bskyod par mi nus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba la rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five dharmas, the nature, the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and the stages of the grounds are connected and distinguished, and one becomes unshakable by the views of non-Buddhists. This is called “the bodhisattva’s abiding in the Immovable Ground.”

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba'i sgo'i lam bcu rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba'i sgo'i lam bcu rab tu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: “One attains the ten paths of the door of the bliss of samādhi.”

original: ting nge 'dzin blos yongs su bzung bas sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa la so sor rab tu rtog pa dang / rang gi smon lam gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i bde ba mi len cing yang dag pa'i mtha' la mi gnas par 'phags @443b pa'i so so rang gis rig par 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin blos yongs su bzung bas sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa la so sor rab tu rtog pa dang / rang gi smon lam gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i bde ba mi len cing yang dag pa'i mtha' la mi gnas par 'phags @443b pa'i so so rang gis rig par 'gro ba dang /
translated: “By the mind’s retention of samādhi, one individually realizes the inconceivable qualities of the buddhas. By one’s aspirations, one does not take up the bliss of the door of samādhi and, without abiding in the limit of reality, one goes to the ārya’s individual knowledge.”

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam 'phags pa'i rigs kyi lam bcu dang / sku dang / ye shes dang / yid las skyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin mngon par 'du byed pa med pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam 'phags pa'i rigs kyi lam bcu dang / sku dang / ye shes dang / yid las skyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin mngon par 'du byed pa med pa rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the path of the noble ones, which is not shared in common with the hearers, solitary buddhas, or tīrthikas; the tenfold path of the noble ones; and the attainment of the body, wisdom, mind-born body, and the effortless absorption.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khyad par 'dod pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yongs su sbyang ba bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khyad par 'dod pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yongs su sbyang ba bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas who desire distinction should thoroughly purify the thusness of the tathāgatagarbha, which is called the ālaya consciousness.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'ang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'ang med par 'gyur te /
translated: if the ālaya consciousness did not exist, the thusness of the tathāgatagarbha would be without arising and ceasing.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'on kyang byis pa dang 'phags pa rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod pas rnal 'byor pa rnams 'phags pa'i so so rang gis rig pa la 'jug cing mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i sbyor ba mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa dang 'phags pa rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa yod pas rnal 'byor pa rnams 'phags pa'i so so rang gis rig pa la 'jug cing mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i sbyor ba mi gtong ngo //
translated: However, since childish beings and āryas are subject to birth and destruction, yogins and yoginīs do not abandon the practice of entering into the āryas’ individual self-awareness and abiding in comfort in this life.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin mod kyi /🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rtog pa'i lta ba can thams cad glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa'i phyir yongs su ma dag pa mthong gi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'di ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yin mod kyi / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rtog pa'i lta ba can thams cad glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa'i phyir yongs su ma dag pa mthong gi /
translated: this tathāgatagarbha, the ālaya consciousness, is indeed pure by nature.

original: de bzhin @444a *//
analyzed: de bzhin @444a *//
translated: However, since it is obscured by adventitious afflictions, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all those with conceptualist views see it as impure.

original: gshegs pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gshegs pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Tathāgatas do not.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mngon sum gyi spyod yul can yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mngon sum gyi spyod yul can yin pas /
translated: since tathāgatas have direct experience,

original: dper na / lag mthil gyi skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhin du gzigs so //
analyzed: dper na / lag mthil gyi skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhin du gzigs so //
translated: they see it as clearly as a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ngas don 'di rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu'i rnam par bzhag pas btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang / gzhan yang shes rab rno zhing yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa bdun dang lhan cig skye bar bstan cing bshad de /
analyzed: ngas don 'di rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu'i rnam par bzhag pas btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang / gzhan yang shes rab rno zhing yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa bdun dang lhan cig skye bar bstan cing bshad de /
translated: I have taught and explained the tathāgata-essence, the all-base consciousness, which arises together with the seven consciousnesses.

original: nyan thos rnams gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir btsun mo phreng ldan ma sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul bshad de /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir btsun mo phreng ldan ma sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul bshad de /
translated: Because the śrāvakas are attached to the view that the individual has no self, Queen Sumati, through the power of the Buddha’s blessing, explained the domain of the tathāgatas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi spyod yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi spyod yul ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the domain of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or tīrthikas.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig dang / gzhan yang shes rab rno zhing don la rton pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can rnams kyi spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig dang / gzhan yang shes rab rno zhing don la rton pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab can rnams kyi spyod yul yin te /
translated: The tathiigatagarbha, the foundation consciousness, is the domain of the Tathagata alone and of the wise bodhisattvas who have sharp faculties and rely on the meaning.

original: de lta bas na blo gros chen po khyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam @444b par shes pa 'di la rab tu brtson zhing bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na blo gros chen po khyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam @444b par shes pa 'di la rab tu brtson zhing bslab par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, Mahamati, you and the other bodhisattva mahasattvas should strive to learn about this tathiigatagarbha, the foundation consciousness.

original: thos pa dang / shes pa tsam gyis chog pa'i 'du shes su mi bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang / shes pa tsam gyis chog pa'i 'du shes su mi bya'o //
translated: Do not be satisfied with mere hearing and understanding.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Lord, in order to teach that very subject, spoke these verses:

original: zab mo de bzhin gshegs pa yi //
analyzed: zab mo de bzhin gshegs pa yi //
translated: The profound tathiigatagarbha

original: snying po rnam shes bdun dag dang / lhan cig 'dzin gnyis rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: snying po rnam shes bdun dag dang / lhan cig 'dzin gnyis rab tu 'jug /
translated: is the seven consciousnesses together with the two.

original: mkhas pa dag ni yongs su spong //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag ni yongs su spong //
translated: The wise ones completely abandon them.

original: me long gzugs bzhin sems snang ste //
analyzed: me long gzugs bzhin sems snang ste //
translated: The mind appears as forms, like in a mirror.

original: thog ma med nas bag chags bsgos //
analyzed: thog ma med nas bag chags bsgos //
translated: From beginningless time, it is cultivated by traces.

original: yang dag ji bzhin rab rtogs na //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin rab rtogs na //
translated: If one realizes the perfect nature as it is,

original: dngos po rnams ni dngos po med //🔽ji ltar byis pa sor mo'i rtser //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni dngos po med // ji ltar byis pa sor mo'i rtser //
translated: things are without things.🔽Just as a child

original: 'dzin cing zla ba mi lta ba //
analyzed: 'dzin cing zla ba mi lta ba //
translated: grasps at the tip of a finger and does not see the moon,

original: de bzhin yi ger zhen pa rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin yi ger zhen pa rnams //
translated: in the same way, those attached to letters

original: nga yi yang dag mthong mi 'gyur //🔽sems ni gar mkhan bzhin du gnas //
analyzed: nga yi yang dag mthong mi 'gyur // sems ni gar mkhan bzhin du gnas //
translated: will not see my perfect truth.🔽The mind abides like a dancer,

original: yid ni ram bu theg pa 'dra //
analyzed: yid ni ram bu theg pa 'dra //
translated: the intellect is like a rope,

original: rnam shes lnga ni grogs lta bu //
analyzed: rnam shes lnga ni grogs lta bu //
translated: the five consciousnesses are like companions,

original: rnam rtog gar rnams rab tu lta //
analyzed: rnam rtog gar rnams rab tu lta //
translated: and the conceptual thoughts are like the dance.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag ma mchis pa gnyis yongs su rtogs par 'gyur ba rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag ma mchis pa gnyis yongs su rtogs par 'gyur ba rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, please explain the characteristics of the classification of the five dharmas, the natures, the consciousnesses, and the two kinds of selflessness, for the sake of realizing them.

original: des bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyang sa thams cad kyi go rims kyi mtshams sbyor zhing chos 'di dag @445a *//
analyzed: des bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyang sa thams cad kyi go rims kyi mtshams sbyor zhing chos 'di dag @445a *//
translated: It will also connect me and other bodhisattvas to the sequence of all the stages, and it will cause them to engage with these phenomena

original: rnam par dbye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: and to engage with all the qualities of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gis rig pa'i sa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gis rig pa'i sa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Engaging with all the qualities of the buddhas, they will enter the stage of the thus-gone ones’ own awareness.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: blo gros chen po /🔽legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: “Mahāmati,🔽listen well and keep this in mind. I will teach it to you.”🔽Mahāmati replied, “Blessed One, I will listen.”

original: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba dang / rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba dang / rab tu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the five dharmas, nature, consciousness, the two kinds of selflessness, and the characteristics of engagement, which are as follows:

original: ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
translated: name, sign, imagination, correct knowledge, and suchness.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsgoms na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsgoms na /
translated: If yogins and yoginīs meditate on these,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i tshul la rab tu 'jug cing rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i lta ba spangs nas mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i tshul la rab tu 'jug cing rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i lta ba spangs nas mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: they will enter the noble way of the thus-gone ones’ self-realization, abandon the views of permanence, annihilation, existence, nonexistence, and so on, and actualize the present-life attainment of the bliss of meditative equipoise.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis dang / rang gi sems snang ba dang / phyi @445b rol gyi dngos po de dag khong du ma chud pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnam par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis dang / rang gi sems snang ba dang / phyi @445b rol gyi dngos po de dag khong du ma chud pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnam par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: Because they have not understood the five dharmas, the two kinds of selflessness, the appearances of their own minds, and external entities, ordinary beings conceive of them.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: But the noble ones do not.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par rtog pa skye la 'phags pa rnams kyis ma lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par rtog pa skye la 'phags pa rnams kyis ma lags /
translated: how is it that the conceptions of ordinary beings arise but not those of the noble ones?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kun rdzob kyi brda'i ming dang rgyu mtshan la mngon par zhen pas sems kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kun rdzob kyi brda'i ming dang rgyu mtshan la mngon par zhen pas sems kyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: ordinary beings follow their minds because they cling to the names and reasons of conventional signs.

original: rjes su 'brangs nas mtshan ma'i kha dog sna tshogs 'dod pas bdag dang bdag gir lta bar lhung ba'i bsam pa can rnams gzugs bzang po la mngon par zhen par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su 'brangs nas mtshan ma'i kha dog sna tshogs 'dod pas bdag dang bdag gir lta bar lhung ba'i bsam pa can rnams gzugs bzang po la mngon par zhen par byed de /
translated: Following after, they desire the various colors of signs. Those who have the idea of falling into the view of “I” and “mine” become attached to good-looking forms.

original: mngon par zhen nas mi shes pas bsgribs pa'i phyir mngon par chags pa skyed do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen nas mi shes pas bsgribs pa'i phyir mngon par chags pa skyed do //
translated: Because of being obscured by ignorance, they generate attachment.

original: mngon par chags par gyur nas ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba'i las bsags so //
analyzed: mngon par chags par gyur nas ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug las byung ba'i las bsags so //
translated: Having become attached, they accumulate karma arisen from desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: mngon par bsags nas ni rnam par rtog pas rang la 'ching bar byed de /
analyzed: mngon par bsags nas ni rnam par rtog pas rang la 'ching bar byed de /
translated: Having accumulated, they bind themselves with conceptuality.

original: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu skon pa byed pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'gro ba rnams kyi skon par lhung ba ni zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu skon pa byed pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'gro ba rnams kyi skon par lhung ba ni zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin te /
translated: Just as a silkworm creates its cocoon, beings who have fallen into the trap of the ocean of saṃsāra are like a water-powered machine.

original: 'di ltar gti mug pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu'i zla ba dang mtshungs par rang bzhin gyis bdag dang bdag gi dang bral bar ma @446a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar gti mug pa'i phyir sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu'i zla ba dang mtshungs par rang bzhin gyis bdag dang bdag gi dang bral bar ma @446a *//
translated: Thus, because of ignorance, like an illusion, a mirage, or the moon in water, they do not understand that [phenomena] are naturally devoid of self and “mine.”

original: shes nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: shes nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad skyed par byed do //
translated: [And so] they give rise to all kinds of false conceptual thoughts.

original: mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang bral ba rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa /
translated: They do not understand that [phenomena] are free from characteristics, the basis of characteristics, arising, and destruction, and are born from their own conceptual thoughts.

original: dbang phyug dang / dus dang / rdul phra mo dang / gtso bo las byung ba ma yin par ma shes nas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ming dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang / dus dang / rdul phra mo dang / gtso bo las byung ba ma yin par ma shes nas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ming dang / rgyu mtshan gyi rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: They do not understand that [phenomena] do not arise from Īśvara, time, subtle atoms, or primordial matter, and so childish ordinary beings follow names and reasons.

original: de la / blo gros chen po rgyu mtshan /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po rgyu mtshan /
translated: Mahāmati, a reason

original: de'ang mig gi rnam par shes pas snang bar bya ba ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang mig gi rnam par shes pas snang bar bya ba ni gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: is what is illuminated by the eye consciousness and is called “form.”

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas snang bar bya ba ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas snang bar bya ba ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ste /
translated: Likewise, the objects of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses are called sounds, smells, tastes, tangible objects, and phenomena.

original: 'di ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “sign.”

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rnam par rtog pa de ni gang gis ming mang por btags nas mtshan ma rnams gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de ni gang gis ming mang por btags nas mtshan ma rnams gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: that conceptualization is what, having designated many names, clarifies the signs.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / rkang thang dang / skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i ming gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / rkang thang dang / skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i ming gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the name of an elephant, a horse, a chariot, a foot soldier, a man, a woman, and so on, which is “thus” and not otherwise, is called “conceptualization.”

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes gang gis ming dang / rgyu mtshan de dag mi dmigs shing phan tshun 'gro ba'i mgron po dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes gang gis ming dang / rgyu mtshan de dag mi dmigs shing phan tshun 'gro ba'i mgron po dang mtshungs te /
translated: by means of the correct wisdom that does not observe those names and signs, and which is like travelers who go their separate ways,

original: rnam par shes pa rnams mi skye @446b bas rtag pa med pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams mi skye @446b bas rtag pa med pa /
translated: Since consciousnesses do not arise, there is no permanence.

original: chad pa med pas mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sar mi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa med pas mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sar mi ltung ba'o //
translated: Since there is no annihilation, one does not fall into the stages of all tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni yang dag pa'i ye shes des ming dang / rgyu mtshan rnam par 'jog par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni yang dag pa'i ye shes des ming dang / rgyu mtshan rnam par 'jog par yang mi byed la /
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas, by means of that correct wisdom, do not posit names and reasons,

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan rnam par mi gzhog pa'ang ma yin pas lta ba gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa yongs su spong bar byed do /
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan rnam par mi gzhog pa'ang ma yin pas lta ba gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa yongs su spong bar byed do /
translated: but also do not fail to posit names and reasons, and thus abandon the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan mi skye ba ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan mi skye ba ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The non-arising of names and reasons is called suchness.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ni snang ba med pa'i spyod yul thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba 'thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ni snang ba med pa'i spyod yul thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba 'thob ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who abides in suchness, having attained the domain of non-appearance, attains the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob nas mu stegs can dang / ngan song gi 'gro ba thams cad las shin tu 'das shing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul la yang dag par gnas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob nas mu stegs can dang / ngan song gi 'gro ba thams cad las shin tu 'das shing 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul la yang dag par gnas pa /
translated: Having attained the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful, he completely transcends all tīrthikas and all lower rebirths and abides in the supramundane way.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'dris pa /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la 'dris pa /
translated: He is familiar with the characteristics of phenomena.

original: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa rang gis rig pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi mtshan nyid rtog ge pa'i lta ba ya mtshan gyi mtshan nyid dang bral bas rim gyis chos kyi sprin gyi bar du 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par 'byed pa rang gis rig pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi mtshan nyid rtog ge pa'i lta ba ya mtshan gyi mtshan nyid dang bral bas rim gyis chos kyi sprin gyi bar du 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: He gradually attains up to the Cloud of Dharma by means of the characteristics of the Dharma of one’s own awareness, which distinguishes all phenomena such as illusions and so on, free from the characteristics of the amazing views of logicians.

original: bar de'ang ting nge 'dzin dang / stobs dang / dbang dang / @447a *//
analyzed: bar de'ang ting nge 'dzin dang / stobs dang / dbang dang / @447a *//
translated: In the meantime, he attains samādhis, powers,

original: mngon par shes pa rgyas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rgyas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain the superknowledges and the stage of the Tathāgata.

original: de thob nas chu'i zla ba bzhin du sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kun tu ston cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu yongs su rdzogs nas mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la rab tu 'byed cing chos ston
analyzed: de thob nas chu'i zla ba bzhin du sprul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kun tu ston cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu yongs su rdzogs nas mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams la rab tu 'byed cing chos ston
translated: Having attained that, like the moon in the water, one will display various emanations and bring sentient beings to maturity. Having perfected the ten ultimate stages, one will distinguish and teach the Dharma to sentient beings with various inclinations.

original: kyang chos kyi sku ni yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kyang chos kyi sku ni yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: However, the dharmakāya is free from mental activity.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin nyid la zhugs nas thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin nyid la zhugs nas thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attainment of the bodhisattvas after entering suchness.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: ci rang bzhin gsum po rnams chos lnga'i nang du 'dus pa zhig lags sam /
analyzed: ci rang bzhin gsum po rnams chos lnga'i nang du 'dus pa zhig lags sam /
translated: Are the three natures included within the five dharmas?

original: 'on te so so nas rang gi mtshan nyid du grub pa zhig lags /
analyzed: 'on te so so nas rang gi mtshan nyid du grub pa zhig lags /
translated: Are they established as having their own characteristics?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rang bzhin gsum dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / bdag med pa gnyis kyang chos lnga'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / bdag med pa gnyis kyang chos lnga'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: the three natures, the eight consciousnesses, and the two kinds of selflessness are included within the five dharmas.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan de dag ni kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan de dag ni kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: those names and causal signs are the imagined nature.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rnam par rtog pa de la brten nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos ming dang lhan cig skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de la brten nas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos ming dang lhan cig skye ste /
translated: based on those conceptual thoughts, the mind and mental factors arise together with names.

original: ji ltar nyi ma dang 'od zer lhan cig 'byung ba @447b bzhin du sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid so sor rnam par rtog cing /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma dang 'od zer lhan cig 'byung ba @447b bzhin du sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid so sor rnam par rtog cing /
translated: Just as the sun and its rays arise together, various characteristics are conceptually differentiated and grasped.

original: 'dzin par byed pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the dependent nature.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because the perfect pristine consciousness and suchness are indestructible, they are called the perfected nature.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam pa brgyad du dbye ste; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam pa brgyad du dbye ste; 'di lta ste /
translated: the appearances of one’s own mind are divided into eight aspects:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o //
translated: the all-base consciousness, the intellect, the mental consciousness, and the five collections of consciousness.

original: de la rgyu mtshan ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la kun tu brtags pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa gnyis 'gags na bdag med pa gnyis skye'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la kun tu brtags pa'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa gnyis 'gags na bdag med pa gnyis skye'o //
translated: Regarding that, the characteristics are the two apprehensions of self and entities that arise from the characteristics of nonreality. When the two apprehensions of self and entities cease, the two absences of self arise.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos lnga po 'di'i nang du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / sa rnams kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang / go rims dang /
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di'i nang du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / sa rnams kyi mtshams sbyar ba dang / go rims dang /
translated: In these five dharmas are included the individual self-cognizant pristine wisdom of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas, the connections between the bhūmis, their sequence,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang 'dus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang 'dus so //
translated: and all the qualities of buddhahood.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: chos lnga ni rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos lnga ni rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the five dharmas are the causal process, names, conceptualization, suchness, and correct pristine wisdom.

original: blo gros chen po /🔽de la rgyu mtshan ni gnas pa dang / dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i @448a *//
analyzed: blo gros chen po / de la rgyu mtshan ni gnas pa dang / dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i @448a *//
translated: Mahāmati,🔽the causal process is the appearance of the characteristics of form and so on, which have the characteristics of location and shape.

original: mtshan nyid du snang ba ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid du snang ba ni rgyu mtshan zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the causal process.

original: gang rgyu mtshan de nyid la bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming yod pas 'di ni de bzhin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni ming zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang rgyu mtshan de nyid la bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming yod pas 'di ni de bzhin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni ming zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since the reason has the name “pot,” etc., it is said, “This is just so, not otherwise.” That is called “name.”

original: ming mang po btags nas rgyu mtshan rnams gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming mang po btags nas rgyu mtshan rnams gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having designated many names, the reasons are clarified.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That dharma of mind and mental factors such as the pot, etc., is called “conceptualization.”

original: ming de dang rgyu mtshan de dag mthar dmigs su med pa dang / thog ma dang / tha mar rig par bya ba med pa dang / chos rnams la phan tshun med pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ming de dang rgyu mtshan de dag mthar dmigs su med pa dang / thog ma dang / tha mar rig par bya ba med pa dang / chos rnams la phan tshun med pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the end of that name and that reason, the non-existence of the beginning and end to be known, the mutual non-existence of dharmas, and the freedom from unreal conceptualization is called “suchness.”

original: de kho na nyid yang dag par nges pa mthar thug par yang rang bzhin dmigs su med pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du nga dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su zhugs shing sems can thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba🔽bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yang dag par nges pa mthar thug par yang rang bzhin dmigs su med pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du nga dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su zhugs shing sems can thams cad la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bshad do //
translated: The ultimate, perfect ascertainment of thatness is also the characteristic of suchness, which I and the tathāgatas have realized, and which we have explained to all sentient beings just as it is.🔽We have revealed it,

original: btags so // gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: btags so // gsal bar byas so //
translated: and we have clarified it.

original: gang de'i rjes su zhugs nas yang dag par rtogs shing chad pa dang rtag pa med pa /
analyzed: gang de'i rjes su zhugs nas yang dag par rtogs shing chad pa dang rtag pa med pa /
translated: Having realized it by following that, without annihilation or permanence,

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshul dang rjes su mthun pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshul dang rjes su mthun pa /
translated: without conceptualization, it is the way of the noble wisdom of individual knowledge,

original: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi dmigs pa'i @448b mtshan nyid de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi dmigs pa'i @448b mtshan nyid de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is the characteristic of the non-apprehension of all tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas. That is called right wisdom.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de dag ni chos lnga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni chos lnga zhes bya ste /
translated: those are called the five dharmas.

original: rang bzhin rnam pa gsum dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / bdag med pa gnyis dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang der 'dus te /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa gsum dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / bdag med pa gnyis dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang der 'dus te /
translated: The three natures, the eight consciousnesses, the two kinds of selflessness, and all the qualities of the buddhas are included in that.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la bdag nyid kyis nan tan du bslab par bya zhing gzhan la'ang bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kyis nan tan du bslab par bya zhing gzhan la'ang bslab par bya ste /
translated: you should train in that yourself and teach it to others.

original: gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not follow others.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, in order to teach that very meaning, the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: chos lnga dang ni rang bzhin gsum //
analyzed: chos lnga dang ni rang bzhin gsum //
translated: The five dharmas, the three natures,🔽The very eight consciousnesses,

original: rnam shes brgyad po nyid dag dang // bdag med don ni rnam gnyis por //
analyzed: rnam shes brgyad po nyid dag dang // bdag med don ni rnam gnyis por //

original: theg chen thams cad bsdus pa yin //
