original: ming dang rgyu mtshan rnam par rtog /
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan rnam par rtog /
translated: Name, sign, and imagination,

original: rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid de //
translated: The characteristic of the two natures,

original: yang dag ye shes de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes de bzhin nyid //
translated: Correct wisdom and suchness

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Are the characteristic of the perfected.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati again said to the Blessed One:

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar na 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar na 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed de /
translated: “As the Blessed One has said, the buddhas of the past are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi'ang de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi'ang de bzhin no zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: and the same is true of those in the future and the present.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di la sgra ji bzhin du don gzung bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'di la sgra ji bzhin du don gzung bar bgyi'am /
translated: should the meaning of this be taken literally,

original: 'on te don gzhan zhig mchis lags /
analyzed: 'on te don gzhan zhig mchis lags /
translated: or is there another meaning?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽thugs brtse bar dgongs @449a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / thugs brtse bar dgongs @449a *//
translated: Blessed One,

original: te bshad du gsol /
analyzed: te bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain this out of compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sgra ji bzhin du don gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du don gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: the meaning should not be taken literally.

original: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni yang dag par gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni yang dag par gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du ma yin no //
translated: The tathāgatas of the three times are not truly as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa las 'das pas dpe rnams kyis dper bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa las 'das pas dpe rnams kyis dper bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it transcends the thoughts of the worldly, it is not an example that can be illustrated by examples.

original: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / mu stegs can gyi rnam par btags pa'i lta ba ngan pa 'phel nas 'khor ba la thug pa med par 'gyur ba dag 'khor bar 'gro ba'i 'khor lo la yongs su skyo bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / mu stegs can gyi rnam par btags pa'i lta ba ngan pa 'phel nas 'khor ba la thug pa med par 'gyur ba dag 'khor bar 'gro ba'i 'khor lo la yongs su skyo bar bya ba dang /
translated: In this way, in order to make those who are attached to the permanence of childish ordinary beings and who have increased the bad views imputed by tīrthikas turn away from the wheel of saṃsāra,

original: brtson 'grus khyad par can rtsom du gzhug pa'i phyir de dag la 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mthong bar sla bas au dumb'a ra'i me tog lta bu ma yin no zhes bstan te mthong bar dka' zhes rtsom pa gtong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro;
analyzed: brtson 'grus khyad par can rtsom du gzhug pa'i phyir de dag la 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni mthong bar sla bas au dumb'a ra'i me tog lta bu ma yin no zhes bstan te mthong bar dka' zhes rtsom pa gtong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro;
translated: in order to make them turn away from the endless saṃsāra and in order to make them apply themselves to special diligence, they are taught, “The tathāgatas are not like udumbara flowers, which are easy to see.”

original: ;res 'ga' ni 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams la gzigs nas 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni shin tu mthong bar dka' bas au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: ;res 'ga' ni 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams la gzigs nas 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni shin tu mthong bar dka' bas au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Sometimes, having seen the people to be trained, he says, “The Tathāgatas are very difficult to see, like the uḍumbara flower.”

original: au dumb'a ra'i me tog ni sus kyang ma mthong /
analyzed: au dumb'a ra'i me tog ni sus kyang ma mthong /
translated: No one has ever seen the uḍumbara flower,

original: mi mthong / mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi mthong / mthong bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: does not see it, and will not see it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis mthong ste /🔽@449b rang gi tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis mthong ste / @449b rang gi tshul rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: But the Tathāgata is seen by the entire world.

original: zhes bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that he says, “The appearance of the Tathāgatas is like the uḍumbara flower,” in order to establish his own way.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rang gi tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa las 'das pas byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag yid ches par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi tshul rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa las 'das pas byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag yid ches par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the establishment of one’s own way transcends the thoughts of the world. Therefore, those childish ordinary beings do not believe it.

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la ni dper bya ba med do //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la ni dper bya ba med do //
translated: In the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones’ individual knowledge, there are no analogies.

original: de kho na nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa las 'das pas mthong bar bya ba'i mtshan ma rnams kyis dpe byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa las 'das pas mthong bar bya ba'i mtshan ma rnams kyis dpe byar mi rung ngo //
translated: The Tathagata of suchness is beyond mind, mentality, and consciousness, and so is not suitable to be exemplified by any signs that are seen.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: 'on kyang ngas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam mo zhes dpes bstan pa la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam mo zhes dpes bstan pa la nyes pa med de /
translated: however, I do not err in teaching with the example of the Tathagatas being equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: dper na / gangg'a'i gi bye ma ni nya dang / rus sbal dang / shi shu m'a ra dang / sengge dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / mi dang / ri dvags rnams gyis gtses shing dkrugs kyang bye ma de 'di snyam du 'di dag gis bdag la gtses so zhes rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i gi bye ma ni nya dang / rus sbal dang / shi shu m'a ra dang / sengge dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / mi dang / ri dvags rnams gyis gtses shing dkrugs kyang bye ma de 'di snyam du 'di dag gis bdag la gtses so zhes rnam par rtog par mi byed de /
translated: for example, the sands of the Ganges are harmed and disturbed by fish, turtles, shushama fish, lions, elephants, horses, humans, and deer, but the sand does not think, 'They are harming me.'

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing dri ma rnams kyis gos ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing dri ma rnams kyis gos ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is naturally pure and unstained by impurities.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi @450a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi @450a *//
translated: In the same way, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha’s own individual knowledge of the noble wisdom

original: gangg'a'i klung chen po la yod pa'i stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i bye ma rnams la'ang mu stegs can thams cad dang / mi rnams dang / ri dvags la sogs pa thams cad kyis gtses shing dkrugs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la dgongs pa mi mnga' bas rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung chen po la yod pa'i stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i bye ma rnams la'ang mu stegs can thams cad dang / mi rnams dang / ri dvags la sogs pa thams cad kyis gtses shing dkrugs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la dgongs pa mi mnga' bas rnam par rtog pa mi skye ste /
translated: is like the power, superknowledge, faculties, and so forth of the sand grains in the great river Ganges. Even if all the tīrthikas, humans, and animals were to harm and disturb them, the Thus-Gone One would not have any thoughts and would not give rise to concepts.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu dben zhing dgongs pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la sems can rnams dgod pa'i phyir rnam par gtses so snyam du mi dgongs pas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mtshungs shing bye brag med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu dben zhing dgongs pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la sems can rnams dgod pa'i phyir rnam par gtses so snyam du mi dgongs pas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mtshungs shing bye brag med do //
translated: The Tathāgata is detached and has no notion of a self, and he does not think that he is tormenting beings in order to establish them in the bliss of concentration by the power of his former vows. He is like the sands of the Ganges, without distinction.

original: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / gti mug yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / gti mug yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, he has completely abandoned attachment, hostility, and ignorance.

original: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams ni sa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas bskal pas tshig pa nas thams cad bsregs kyang sa'i 'byung ba chen po ni rang bzhin mi 'dor te /
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams ni sa'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas bskal pas tshig pa nas thams cad bsregs kyang sa'i 'byung ba chen po ni rang bzhin mi 'dor te /
translated: For example, the sands of the Ganges have the nature of the earth. Even if the world burns up at the end of the eon and everything is consumed by fire, the great element of earth does not abandon its nature.

original: 'di ltar me'i khams dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i khams dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is born together with the fire element.

original: gzhan du na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams tshig par rtog mod kyi sa de ni mi tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams tshig par rtog mod kyi sa de ni mi tshig ste /
translated: Otherwise, ordinary people would think that the earth is burning, but it is not burning,

original: 'di ltar me'i khams kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i khams kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the fire element.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,🔽the dharmakāya of the Tathāgatas is indestructible like the sands of the Ganges.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'ang gangg'a'i klung @450b gi bye ma ltar mi 'jig go blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'ang gangg'a'i klung @450b gi bye ma ltar mi 'jig go blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams la ni tshad med do //
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams la ni tshad med do //
translated: the sands of the Ganges are immeasurable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od zer rnams kyang de bzhin du tshad med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'od zer rnams kyang de bzhin du tshad med de /
translated: The light rays of the Tathāgatas are also like that, immeasurable.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kun tu snang bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kun tu snang bar byed do //
translated: In order to ripen sentient beings, all buddhas illuminate all the maṇḍalas of the retinue.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na; gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams la ni bye ma tha dad pa gzhan btsal na nam yang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: dper na; gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams la ni bye ma tha dad pa gzhan btsal na nam yang mi rnyed do //
translated: for example, if one were to search for separate, different sands among the sands of the Ganges, one would never find them.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la'ang 'khor ba'ang med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la'ang 'khor ba'ang med /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is also not in saṃsāra.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med de /
translated: He is not born and does not cease.

original: srid pa'i rgyu dang rkyen chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu dang rkyen chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the causes and conditions of existence are severed.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa shes par mi nus so //
translated: for example, the sands of the Ganges River cannot be known to increase or decrease.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mi 'phel mi 'grib ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mi 'phel mi 'grib ste /
translated: the wisdom of the Tathāgata does not increase or decrease in bringing sentient beings to maturity,

original: lus kyi chos can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi chos can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a dharma of the body.

original: lus kyi chos can la ni 'jig pa yod kyi /
analyzed: lus kyi chos can la ni 'jig pa yod kyi /
translated: For that which is a dharma of the body has destruction,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni lus kyi chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni lus kyi chos can ma yin no //
translated: but the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata is not a dharma of the body.

original: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rab tu btsir kyang mar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rab tu btsir kyang mar mi dmigs so //
translated: For example, even if the sands of the Ganges River are pressed, oil is not observed.

original: de bzhin du sems can gyi rab tu gnod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la gnod @451a *//🔽pa byas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gyi rab tu gnod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la gnod @451a *// pa byas kyang /
translated: Likewise, although the Thus-Gone One is harmed by all the intense suffering and harm of sentient beings,

original: ji srid du sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du chos kyi dbyings mi 'dor te /
analyzed: ji srid du sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du chos kyi dbyings mi 'dor te /
translated: he does not abandon the realm of phenomena until all sentient beings have attained complete nirvāṇa.

original: rang gi ting nge 'dzin dang / smon lam gyi bde ba dang / thugs rje chen po'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rang gi ting nge 'dzin dang / smon lam gyi bde ba dang / thugs rje chen po'i phyir ro /
translated: This is because of his own bliss of absorption, his aspirations, and his great compassion.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams ni chu'i rgyun gyi rjes su 'bab ste /
analyzed: dper na / gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnams ni chu'i rgyun gyi rjes su 'bab ste /
translated: the sands of the Ganges flow in the wake of the river’s current,🔽but not without water.

original: chu med par ni ma yin no; ;de bzhin du /🔽blo gros chen po /
analyzed: chu med par ni ma yin no; ;de bzhin du / blo gros chen po /
translated: Likewise,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun gyi rjes su 'bab pas de'i phyir 'di skad du gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun gyi rjes su 'bab pas de'i phyir 'di skad du gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Mahāmati, all the teachings of the thus-gone ones flow in the wake of the current of nirvāṇa. Therefore, it is explained that they are equal to the sands of the Ganges.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi rjes su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi rjes su mi 'jug ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One does not follow the migrations of beings.

original: rjes su 'bab cing 'gro ba ni 'jig pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'bab cing 'gro ba ni 'jig pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because to follow and go is the meaning of destruction.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'khor ba'i thog ma'i mtha' shes par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i thog ma'i mtha' shes par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because the beginning of saṃsāra cannot be known,

original: shes pa med na ji ltar 'gro ba zhes bshad /
analyzed: shes pa med na ji ltar 'gro ba zhes bshad /
translated: how can it be explained as a migration if it is not known?

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i don yin na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i don yin na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: what is called migration has the meaning of annihilation, but it is not understood by foolish ordinary beings.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te sems can rnams 'khor ba'i thog ma'i mtha' 'tshal ba ma mchis na ji ltar rnam par thar pa khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams 'khor ba'i thog ma'i mtha' 'tshal ba ma mchis na ji ltar rnam par thar pa khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: if sentient beings do not know the beginning of saṃsāra, how will they understand complete liberation?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: @451b thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par spros pa'i gnas ngan len rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu 'gag cing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du mthong ba'i tshe shes so //
analyzed: @451b thog ma med pa'i dus kyi rnam par spros pa'i gnas ngan len rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu 'gag cing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du mthong ba'i tshe shes so //
translated: When the cause of the latent tendencies of conceptual thoughts, the negative tendencies of conceptual elaborations since beginningless time, is stopped, and when one sees one’s mind as mere appearance, one understands.

original: phyi rol gyi don dang / rnam par rtog pa'i lus gnas gyur pa la thar pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dang / rnam par rtog pa'i lus gnas gyur pa la thar pa zhes bya'i /
translated: “ Liberation” is said to be the transformation of the body of conceptual thoughts and external objects.

original: 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not annihilation.

original: de bas na mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni ci'ang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na mtha' med pa zhes bya ba ni ci'ang med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, “infinite” does not mean nothing at all.

original: de dag rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mtha' med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mtha' med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming gi rnam grangs byas pa yin no //
translated: Because of conceptual thoughts, it is given the names “infinite” and so on.

original: phyi dang nang gnyis ka rab tu brtags na rnam par rtog pa las logs shig na gzhan tha dad pa'i sems can gang yang med pas shes pa dang / shes bya dang / chos thams cad ni rab tu dben pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gnyis ka rab tu brtags na rnam par rtog pa las logs shig na gzhan tha dad pa'i sems can gang yang med pas shes pa dang / shes bya dang / chos thams cad ni rab tu dben pa yin te /
translated: When one thoroughly investigates both the external and the internal, since there are no sentient beings separate from conceptual thoughts, consciousness, objects of consciousness, and all phenomena are completely isolated.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa skye'i /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa skye'i /
translated: Because they do not fully understand the conceptual thoughts that appear to their own minds, conceptual thoughts arise.

original: gal te yongs su shes par gyur na ni ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yongs su shes par gyur na ni ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they were to fully understand them, they would cease.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, in order to teach just this meaning, the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: 'dren pa rnams ni rab brtags na //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni rab brtags na //
translated: “The guides are examined

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma bzhin //🔽'jig pa med cing 'gro ba med //
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma bzhin // 'jig pa med cing 'gro ba med //
translated: Like the sands of the Ganges River.🔽They are not destroyed, do not go,

original: mthar thug min pa'ang ma yin te //🔽de ni mnyam pa nyid dag gis //
analyzed: mthar thug min pa'ang ma yin te // de ni mnyam pa nyid dag gis //
translated: And are not ultimately nonexistent.🔽They are examined by the tathāgatas

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams brtags pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams brtags pa yin //
translated: Through their sameness.

original: gangg'a'i bye ma la sogs ltar //
analyzed: gangg'a'i bye ma la sogs ltar //
translated: Like the sands of the Ganges River,

original: nyes pa thams cad rab @452a *//
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad rab @452a *//
translated: All faults are completely abandoned.

original: spangs te // rgyun phyogs 'jug cing rang bzhin rtags //
analyzed: spangs te // rgyun phyogs 'jug cing rang bzhin rtags //
translated: They flow in the stream and are naturally permanent.

original: de ni sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: That is the buddhahood of the buddhas.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati again said this to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad skad cig mar 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol //
analyzed: chos thams cad skad cig mar 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the characteristics of the momentary disintegration of all phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad skad cig ma lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad skad cig ma lags /
translated: how are all phenomena momentary?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: therefore listen well and keep this in mind. I will explain it to you.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽I will listen to the Blessed One’s teachings.”

original: de bzhin du 'tshal zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: in this regard, what are called ‘all phenomena’ are as follows:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang /
translated: virtuous, non-virtuous, indeterminate, determinate, compounded, uncompounded, mundane, supramundane, reprehensible,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / zin pa dang / ma zin pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / zin pa dang / ma zin pa rnams yin te /
translated: They are: the non-offensive, the defiled, the undefiled, the appropriated, and the non-appropriated.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: mdor na sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / @452b bag chags rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rgyu dang / sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags rgyas par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mdor na sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / @452b bag chags rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rgyu dang / sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags rgyas par byed pa yin te /
translated: in brief, mind, mentation, and the various consciousnesses, along with their habitual tendencies, are the causes of the five appropriated aggregates, and they cause the habitual tendencies of mind, mentation, and the various consciousnesses to increase.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dge ba dang / mi dge bar yongs su brtags so //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dge ba dang / mi dge bar yongs su brtags so //
translated: They are imagined by foolish ordinary beings to be virtuous and non-virtuous.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dge ba zag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dge ba zag pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the bliss of samadhi and the virtuous undefiled states of the noble ones who abide in the bliss of the Dharma they see are called virtuous.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: virtuous and non-virtuous are as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnams so //
translated: they are the eight consciousnesses.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs rnams te /
translated: The tathāgatagarbha, proclaimed to be the ālaya-consciousness, the mind, mentation, the mental consciousness, and the five collections of consciousness.

original: mu stegs can gyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not to be expressed by the tīrthikas.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa /
translated: the five collections of consciousness are together with the mind, mentation, and the mental consciousness.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid phan tshun du rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid phan tshun du rnam par 'gyur zhing 'jig pa /
translated: They mutually transform and perish, characterized as virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun gyis 'jug pas rnam par mi 'jig pa /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun gyis 'jug pas rnam par mi 'jig pa /
translated: They are not destroyed by the continuity of the stream.

original: lus byung nas skye zhing 'jig par yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus byung nas skye zhing 'jig par yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They arise and perish after the body has arisen.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'gags ma thag tu rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'gags ma thag tu rnam par shes pa gzhan 'byung ste /
translated: Because they do not realize that they are mere appearances of one’s own mind, another consciousness arises immediately after the cessation of the previous one.

original: @453a *// dbyings kyi bye brag 'dzin pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan par 'byung zhing skad cig gi dus su'ang mi gnas pa de ni skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @453a *// dbyings kyi bye brag 'dzin pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan par 'byung zhing skad cig gi dus su'ang mi gnas pa de ni skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The specific dhātu is the mental consciousness that apprehends, which arises in conjunction with the five collections of consciousness. It does not remain even for a moment, and that is called a moment.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yid dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyis skad cig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yid dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyis skad cig pa yin gyi /
translated: in that regard, what is called a moment is the ālaya consciousness, proclaimed to be the essence of the tathāgatas. It is momentary due to the latent tendencies of the coemergent consciousness,

original: zag pa med pa'i bag chags kyis skad cig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bag chags kyis skad cig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not momentary due to the latent tendencies of the uncontaminated.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not realized by childish ordinary beings.

original: 'di ltar skad cig mar smra ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir chos thams cad skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa 'di mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig mar smra ba la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir chos thams cad skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa 'di mi rtogs so //
translated: Because they are attached to the doctrine of momentariness, they do not realize that all phenomena are momentary and not momentary.

original: de chad par lta ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams kyang 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: de chad par lta ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams kyang 'jig par byed do //
translated: Because they hold the view of annihilation, they also destroy unconditioned phenomena.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rnam par shes pa bdun po rnams ni 'khor bar 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun po rnams ni 'khor bar 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: the seven consciousnesses are not what engages saṃsāra.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang mi myong la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang mi myong la /
translated: They do not experience suffering or happiness,

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rgyu'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rgyu'ang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not the cause of nirvāṇa.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang myong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni sdug bsngal dang bde ba'ang myong ste /
translated: the tathāgatagarbha experiences suffering and happiness.

original: rgyu dang lhan cig tu 'jug cing ldog go /
analyzed: rgyu dang lhan cig tu 'jug cing ldog go /
translated: It engages and disengages together with the causes.

original: gnas pa'i sa gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i gnas kyis rab tu myos pas byis pa so so'i skye bo dag skad cig @453b mar lta ba mi rtogs shing /
analyzed: gnas pa'i sa gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i gnas kyis rab tu myos pas byis pa so so'i skye bo dag skad cig @453b mar lta ba mi rtogs shing /
translated: Because it is intoxicated by the ground of the abode and the abode of ignorance, childish ordinary beings do not realize momentary [phenomena].

original: rnam par rtog pas sems yongs su bsgos par gyur to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas sems yongs su bsgos par gyur to //
translated: They are thoroughly imbued with a mind of conceptuality.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: dper na / gser dang / rdo rje dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel dang / khyad par thob pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / gser dang / rdo rje dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel dang / khyad par thob pa'i ngo bo nyid ni nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: For example, the nature of gold, a diamond, and the relics of the Tathāgata never perish.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gal te mngon par rtogs pa thob pa skad cig pa yin na ni 'phags pa rnams 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te mngon par rtogs pa thob pa skad cig pa yin na ni 'phags pa rnams 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: if the attainment of realization were momentary, then the noble ones would become non-noble.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'phags pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'phags pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the noble ones do not become non-noble.

original: dper na / gser dang / rdo rje ni bskal pa srid du mi 'brin ci'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo nga'i ldem por dgongs te bshad pa la mi mkhas pa dag gis phyi nang gi chos thams cad la skad cig pa'i don du rtog /
analyzed: dper na / gser dang / rdo rje ni bskal pa srid du mi 'brin ci'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo nga'i ldem por dgongs te bshad pa la mi mkhas pa dag gis phyi nang gi chos thams cad la skad cig pa'i don du rtog /
translated: For example, gold and a diamond do not perish for the duration of an eon. Why? Because foolish ordinary beings are unskilled in my indirect teachings. They conceive all outer and inner phenomena to be momentary.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Mahāmati again said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par spyad na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par spyad na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: The Blessed One has said, “If one practices the six perfections completely, one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.”

original: drug po gang lags /
analyzed: drug po gang lags /
translated: What are the six?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bye brag ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bye brag ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: there are three types of distinctions in the perfections:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las @454a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las @454a *//
translated: namely,🔽those of the mundane,

original: 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog go /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog go /
translated: the supramundane, and the supreme supramundane.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen cing mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa /
translated: the mundane perfections are those that cling to the notions of self and “mine” and grasp at the two extremes.

original: skye ba'i gnas sna tshogs blang ba dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la rab tu mos pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas sna tshogs blang ba dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la rab tu mos pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They perfect the perfection of generosity in order to take up various births and to be devoted to form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyang de bzhin te byis pa so so'i skye bo'i mngon par shes pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyang de bzhin te byis pa so so'i skye bo'i mngon par shes pa yongs su 'grub pa dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They also do the same with morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom, in order to achieve the superknowledges of ordinary, childish beings and to be born in the world of Brahmā.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'dzin par lhung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod cing rang gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'dzin par lhung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod cing rang gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la mos pa'o //
translated: the supramundane perfections are practiced by the hearers and solitary realizers, who are attached to the attainment of nirvāṇa, and who are devoted to the bliss of their own nirvāṇa.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi sems snang ba rnams rtog pa tsam du rtogs pa dang / rang gi sems gnyis su 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba dang / 'gro ba rnams len pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi sems snang ba rnams rtog pa tsam du rtogs pa dang / rang gi sems gnyis su 'dzin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi skye ba dang / 'gro ba rnams len pa dang /
translated: The supreme supramundane perfection is the generation of the perfection of generosity by those who have realized that all appearances are mere conceptual thoughts, who do not generate the conceptual thought of the duality of their own mind, and who are free of the grasping of the duality of sentient beings.

original: skal ba mtshungs pa ma yin pa dang / rang @454b gi sems dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par ma chags pas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skal ba mtshungs pa ma yin pa dang / rang @454b gi sems dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par ma chags pas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa skyed par byed do //
translated: It is the generation of the perfection of generosity for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings, by those who are not of the same fortune as migrating beings, who are not attached to the characteristics of their own mind and form.

original: sbyor ba mchog bskyed nas dmigs pa de nyid la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: sbyor ba mchog bskyed nas dmigs pa de nyid la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ni tshul khrims te /
translated: Having generated the supreme application, the non-engagement of conceptual thought in that very object is morality.

original: de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: That is the perfection of morality.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa mi skye bar bzod cing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa yongs su shes pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa mi skye bar bzod cing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa yongs su shes pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The patience of the non-arising of that very conceptual thought, and the thorough understanding of the grasped and the grasper, is the perfection of patience.

original: gang gis nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la sbyor ba la brtson par byed cing rnal 'byor dang mthun par rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nam gyi cha stod dang / cha smad la sbyor ba la brtson par byed cing rnal 'byor dang mthun par rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the effort to apply oneself to the first and last watches of the night, and to be in accord with yoga, without engaging in discursive thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa rab tu ldog cing nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'dzin par mi ltung ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rab tu ldog cing nyan thos kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'dzin par mi ltung ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the turning away from discursive thought, and the not falling into the grasping of the śrāvakas’ nirvāṇa.

original: de la rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dngos po med par shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas mtha' gnyis su ltung ba dang / sngon gyi lus gnas rab tu gyur pas rnam par mi 'jig pa dang / so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i tshul thob pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dngos po med par shes rab kyis so sor brtags nas mtha' gnyis su ltung ba dang / sngon gyi lus gnas rab tu gyur pas rnam par mi 'jig pa dang / so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i tshul thob pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom that, having investigated the non-entityness of one’s own mind’s discursive thought, does not fall into the two extremes, and is not destroyed by the transformation of the body of the past, and is the attainment of the noble way of individual intuitive wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Lord, in order to teach just this meaning, recited these verses:

original: stong pa mi rtag skad cig mar //
analyzed: stong pa mi rtag skad cig mar //
translated: Empty, impermanent, momentary,

original: byis @455a *// pa rnams ni rnam par rtog /
analyzed: byis @455a *// pa rnams ni rnam par rtog /
translated: are imagined by the childish.

original: 'bab chu mar me sa bon ltar //
analyzed: 'bab chu mar me sa bon ltar //
translated: Like a waterfall, a lamp, a seed,

original: skad cig pa yi don du rtog /
analyzed: skad cig pa yi don du rtog /
translated: they are imagined to be momentary.

original: skad cig nyon mongs 'khrug pa zhi //
analyzed: skad cig nyon mongs 'khrug pa zhi //
translated: Momentary, free from the disturbance of afflictions,

original: rab tu dben pa byed pa spangs //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa byed pa spangs //
translated: isolated, free from activity,

original: chos rnams skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: chos rnams skye ba med pa ni //
translated: the non-arising of phenomena

original: skad cig don du ngas bshad de //
analyzed: skad cig don du ngas bshad de //
translated: is explained by me as the meaning of momentariness.

original: dngos po skyes nas 'jig par ni //
analyzed: dngos po skyes nas 'jig par ni //
translated: The arising and ceasing of entities

original: byis pa rnams la mi 'chad do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la mi 'chad do //
translated: is not explained to the childish.

original: bar chad med par rgyun chags dngos //
analyzed: bar chad med par rgyun chags dngos //
translated: The uninterrupted continuum of entities

original: rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgos //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgos //
translated: is thoroughly imagined by conceptualization.

original: ma rig pa ni rgyu byed de //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rgyu byed de //
translated: Ignorance acts as the cause,

original: sems ni de las rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: sems ni de las rab tu 'byung //
translated: and the mind arises from that.

original: ji srid gzugs dag ma skyes pa //
analyzed: ji srid gzugs dag ma skyes pa //
translated: As long as forms do not arise,

original: de yi bar du phyogs ci yod //
analyzed: de yi bar du phyogs ci yod //
