original: zhig par gyur ma thag tu ni //
analyzed: zhig par gyur ma thag tu ni //
translated: Immediately upon ceasing,

original: sems gzhan de yi rjes su skye //
analyzed: sems gzhan de yi rjes su skye //
translated: another mind arises after it.

original: gzugs ni dus su mi gnas na //
analyzed: gzugs ni dus su mi gnas na //
translated: If form does not abide for a moment,

original: ci la dmigs te 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci la dmigs te 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: what object does it arise from?

original: de dag las ni rab 'byung phyir //
analyzed: de dag las ni rab 'byung phyir //
translated: Because they arise from those,

original: yang dag ma yin rgyu las skyes //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin rgyu las skyes //
translated: And arise from unreal causes.

original: ji ltar grub pa med pa des //
analyzed: ji ltar grub pa med pa des //
translated: By that very non-establishment,

original: skad cig 'jig par rab tu shes //
analyzed: skad cig 'jig par rab tu shes //
translated: One should know the momentariness of destruction.🔽The meditative equipoise of the yogis,🔽The relics of the vajra buddha,

original: rnal 'byor can gyi snyoms 'jug dang // rdo rje sangs rgyas ring bsrel dang // 'od gsal gnas kyi gzhal med khang //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyi snyoms 'jug dang // rdo rje sangs rgyas ring bsrel dang // 'od gsal gnas kyi gzhal med khang //
translated: The celestial palace of the abode of luminosity,

original: 'jig rten mi 'jig dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten mi 'jig dngos po'o //
translated: Are the things that do not perish in the world.🔽The attainment of the true Dharma, the abode,

original: yang dag chos thob gnas pa dang // de bzhin gshegs mkhyen phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: yang dag chos thob gnas pa dang // de bzhin gshegs mkhyen phun sum tshogs //
translated: And the perfection of the knowledge of the Tathagata,

original: dge slong mnyam pa nyid thob rnams //
analyzed: dge slong mnyam pa nyid thob rnams //
translated: The monks who have attained equality,

original: skad cig ma ni ji ltar mthong //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni ji ltar mthong //
translated: How do they see the momentariness?

original: dri za sgyu ma la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: dri za sgyu ma la sogs pa'i //
translated: The forms of gandharvas, illusions, and so forth,

original: gzugs rnams skad cig yod ma @455b yin //
analyzed: gzugs rnams skad cig yod ma @455b yin //
translated: Do not exist in the moment.

original: yang dag ma yin gzugs sogs la //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin gzugs sogs la //
translated: In unreal forms and so forth,

original: yang dag nyid du lta bar byed //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du lta bar byed //
translated: One views them as real.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati again said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du dgra bcom pa rnams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs shing bye brag ma mchis par 'gyur ro
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du dgra bcom pa rnams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs shing bye brag ma mchis par 'gyur ro
translated: Blessed One, since you have prophesied that even arhats will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, it would be the same as the bodhisattvas and there would be no distinction.

original: // gal te sems can rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can lags na su zhig mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur /
analyzed: // gal te sems can rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can lags na su zhig mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur /
translated: If sentient beings are endowed with nirvāṇa, who would fully awaken?

original: gzhan yang ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i bar du yi ge gcig kyang ma
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i bar du yi ge gcig kyang ma
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, from the night the Tathāgata fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood until the night he will pass into parinirvāṇa, he has not uttered a single syllable,

original: gsungs / lan btab pa'ang med ces bka' stsal /
analyzed: gsungs / lan btab pa'ang med ces bka' stsal /
translated: nor has he given any reply.”

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i phyir rtog pa'ang med /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i phyir rtog pa'ang med /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgatas are always in meditative equipoise, so they have no discursive thought.

original: dpyod pa'ang med do //
analyzed: dpyod pa'ang med do //
translated: They also have no analysis.

original: sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa dag sprul to //
analyzed: sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa dag sprul to //
translated: The emanated Tathāgata performs the deeds of a Buddha.

original: gzhan yang ci'i slad du rnam par shes pa rnams ni skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do @456a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i slad du rnam par shes pa rnams ni skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu rnam par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do @456a *//
translated: Moreover, why is it said that the consciousnesses are characterized by momentary destruction from one to the next?

original: zhes gsungs / gzhan yang lag na rdo rje mthu bo che ni rtag tu 'brang zhing srung bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes gsungs / gzhan yang lag na rdo rje mthu bo che ni rtag tu 'brang zhing srung bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, the powerful Vajrapāṇi always follows and protects.

original: thog ma'i mthar mi 'dogs so zhes gsungs /
analyzed: thog ma'i mthar mi 'dogs so zhes gsungs /
translated: It is said that he is not appointed at the beginning.

original: gzhan yang bdud dang / bdud kyi las dang / kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dang / bram ze'i bu mo tsan tsa dang / mdzes ma kun tu rgyu dang / lhung bzed stong par slar gshegs pa la sogs pa las kyi sgrib pa dag gda' na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdud dang / bdud kyi las dang / kha na ma tho ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dang / bram ze'i bu mo tsan tsa dang / mdzes ma kun tu rgyu dang / lhung bzed stong par slar gshegs pa la sogs pa las kyi sgrib pa dag gda' na /
translated: Moreover, since there are the ripening of Māra, the deeds of Māra, and the obscurations of wrongdoing, such as the brahman girl Cañcā, the wandering ascetic Sundarī, and returning with an empty alms bowl,

original: ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes kyang nongs pa rnams ma bral /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes brnyes kyang nongs pa rnams ma bral /
translated: Why is it that, although the Bhagavān has attained the wisdom of omniscience, he has not eliminated faults?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //
translated: therefore listen well and keep this in mind! I will explain it to you.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽we would be delighted to hear it.

original: de bzhin 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir bshad de /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir bshad de /
translated: I will explain it for the sake of attaining nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan dag  na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa gang dag nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mos pa de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa las bzlog nas theg @456b pa chen po la rab tu brtson
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan dag  na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa gang dag nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mos pa de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa las bzlog nas theg @456b pa chen po la rab tu brtson
translated: In order to delight those who are practicing the bodhisattva deeds, and in order to turn away from the Hearers’ Vehicle those who are practicing the bodhisattva deeds in this world and others and are devoted to attaining nirvana by means of the Hearers’ Vehicle, and to make them strive for the Great Vehicle,🔽

original: par bya ba'i phyir sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis nyan thos rnams la lung bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis nyan thos rnams la lung bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: In order to inspire those who practice the bodhisattva deeds, and in order to turn away from the vehicle of the hearers those who practice the bodhisattva deeds in this world and others but aspire to attain nirvana through the vehicle of the hearers, the emanation buddhas prophesy the hearers.

original: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not prophesy them as buddhas in terms of the ultimate.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rgyu des na nyan thos rnams byang chub sems dpa' dag dang tha mi dad par lung bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu des na nyan thos rnams byang chub sems dpa' dag dang tha mi dad par lung bstan to //
translated: for that reason the hearers are prophesied as being indistinguishable from the bodhisattvas.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de la tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / rnam par grol ba ro gcig pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: de la tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / rnam par grol ba ro gcig pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: “Sameness” means that the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and Bhagavat Buddhas are the same in having abandoned the afflictive obstructions and in being liberated.

original: ye shes kyi sgrib pa spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgrib pa spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not the same in having abandoned the obstructions to omniscience.

original: blo gros chen po; ye shes kyi sgrib pa ni chos bdag med par mthong ba'i khyad par gyis rnam par dag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po; ye shes kyi sgrib pa ni chos bdag med par mthong ba'i khyad par gyis rnam par dag par 'gyur la /
translated: Mahāmati, the obstructions to omniscience are purified by the difference in seeing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni sngar gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba la goms pas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni sngar gang zag la bdag med par mthong ba la goms pas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The afflictive obstructions are abandoned by previously cultivating the view of the selflessness of persons.

original: de la rnam par shes pa bdun 'gags pa dang / chos kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags 'gags pas ni mthar thug pa'i rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa bdun 'gags pa dang / chos kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags 'gags pas ni mthar thug pa'i rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, the cessation of the seven consciousnesses, liberation from the obstructions to the Dharma, and the cessation of the latent tendencies of the foundation consciousness are the ultimate purification.

original: sngon gyi chos gnas pa nyid la dgongs pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dngos po med do //🔽mthar thug pa'i smon lam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rtog pa'ang med /
analyzed: sngon gyi chos gnas pa nyid la dgongs pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dngos po med do // mthar thug pa'i smon lam gyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rtog pa'ang med /
translated: Because he is intent on the abiding of the Dharma from the past, there is no difference between the former and the latter.🔽Because of the ultimate aspiration, the Tathagata teaches the Dharma without conceptualization

original: dpyod pa'ang med par chos 'chad de /
analyzed: dpyod pa'ang med par chos 'chad de /
translated: and without analysis.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis sprul pa'i phyir dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir rtog @457a *//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis sprul pa'i phyir dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir rtog @457a *//
translated: Because of the emanation of perfect pristine consciousness and the absence of degeneration of mindfulness, there is no conceptualization

original: pa'ang med / dpyod pa'ang med do //
analyzed: pa'ang med / dpyod pa'ang med do //
translated: and no analysis.

original: gnas pa'i sa gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa gnyis spangs pa dang / 'chi 'pho gnyis dang bral ba dang / gang zag dang chos bdag med par khong du chud pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i sa gzhi dang / ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa gnyis spangs pa dang / 'chi 'pho gnyis dang bral ba dang / gang zag dang chos bdag med par khong du chud pa dang / sgrib pa gnyis spangs pa'o //
translated: Because of abandoning the ground of the abode of ignorance and the latent tendencies of the ground, there is the abandonment of the two afflictions, freedom from the two deaths, comprehension of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and the abandonment of the two obscurations.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bdun po rnams ni skad cig ma /
analyzed: yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bdun po rnams ni skad cig ma /
translated: the mind, mental consciousness, and the seven consciousnesses, such as the eye consciousness, are momentary.

original: bag chags kyi rgyu dge ba zag pa med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba /
analyzed: bag chags kyi rgyu dge ba zag pa med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from the cause of habitual tendencies, the undefiled side of virtue,

original: yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba dang bral ba yin no //
translated: and free from not cycling in saṃsāra.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni 'khor zhing mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni 'khor zhing mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: the tathāgatagarbha is the cause of cycling and of attaining nirvāṇa, of happiness and of suffering,

original: stong pa nyid kyis g-yeng ba'i blo can dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis g-yeng ba'i blo can dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis khong du mi chud do //
translated: but it is not understood by those with distracted minds who are distracted by emptiness and by foolish ordinary beings.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: lag na rdo rje mthu bo che rjes su 'brang zhing srung bar byed pa ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas yin gyi /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje mthu bo che rjes su 'brang zhing srung bar byed pa ni sprul pa'i sangs rgyas yin gyi /
translated: the one who follows and protects the powerful Vajrapāṇi is an emanation buddha,

original: yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the true Tathāgata.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni dbang po dang / tshad ma thams dang bral bas byis pa so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyi dbang po dang / tshad ma rnams las @457b rnam par log pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni dbang po dang / tshad ma thams dang bral bas byis pa so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyi dbang po dang / tshad ma rnams las @457b rnam par log pa yin te /
translated: The perfect Tathāgata is free from all faculties and valid cognitions, and so is completely different from the faculties and valid cognitions of all childish ordinary beings, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tīrthikas.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bar chad med pa'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i phyir lag na rdo rjes bsrung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bar chad med pa'i chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i phyir lag na rdo rjes bsrung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because he has attained the acceptance of the knowledge of the uninterrupted Dharma, he abides in comfort in this very life and is not to be protected by Vajrapāṇi.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad ni las las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad ni las las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: All emanated buddhas are not born from karma.

original: 'phrul bas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas kyang ma yin //
analyzed: 'phrul bas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas kyang ma yin //
translated: Emanated buddhas are not buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las gzhan pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: They are not different from buddhas.

original: dper na / rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rgyu lta bur sems can gyi bya ba byed cing mtshan rnams dang ldan pas chos ston kyang rang gi tshul gyi gnas so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na / rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rgyu lta bur sems can gyi bya ba byed cing mtshan rnams dang ldan pas chos ston kyang rang gi tshul gyi gnas so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: he acts for the sake of sentient beings. He teaches the Dharma by means of the marks, but he does not explain the domain of the individual intuitive wisdom of his own mode of being.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bdun 'gags pa'i phyir ni chad par lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bdun 'gags pa'i phyir ni chad par lta ba bskyed do //
translated: because of the cessation of the seven collections of consciousness, childish ordinary beings generate the view of annihilation.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ni rtag par lta ba bskyed do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir ni rtag par lta ba bskyed do //
translated: Because of not understanding the store consciousness, they generate the view of permanence.

original: bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ni thog ma'i mtha' mi shes so //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ni thog ma'i mtha' mi shes so //
translated: Because of their own conceptualization, they do not understand the primordial limit.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'gags pa'i phyir ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'gags pa'i phyir ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the cessation of their own conceptual mind, they become liberated.

original: gnas pa'i sa gzhi dang ma rig pa gnas kyi sa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir nyes pa thams cad spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i sa gzhi dang ma rig pa gnas kyi sa'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir nyes pa thams cad spangs pa yin no //
translated: Because of abandoning the ground of the abode and the latent tendencies of the ground of the abode of ignorance, they abandon all faults.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: verses:

original: theg pa gsum ni theg ma yin //🔽de bzhin gshegs @458a *//
analyzed: theg pa gsum ni theg ma yin // de bzhin gshegs @458a *//
translated: The three vehicles are not a vehicle.

original: pa zad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: pa zad mi 'gyur //
translated: The Tathagata is inexhaustible.

original: thams cad sangs rgyas lung bstan cing //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas lung bstan cing //
translated: All are predicted to Buddhahood

original: nyes pa rnams dang bral bar bshad //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams dang bral bar bshad //
translated: and are said to be free from faults.🔽In order to attain the realization of the wisdom🔽of nirvana without remainder,

original: mngon rtogs ye shes thob bya dang // lhag med mya ngan 'da' ba dang // zhum pa rnams kyang spro bya'i phyir //
analyzed: mngon rtogs ye shes thob bya dang // lhag med mya ngan 'da' ba dang // zhum pa rnams kyang spro bya'i phyir //
translated: and to encourage the fainthearted,

original: de phyir dgongs te bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir dgongs te bshad pa yin //
translated: therefore it is an intentional explanation.

original: sangs rgyas bskyed pa'i ye shes dag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bskyed pa'i ye shes dag /
translated: The wisdom that gives rise to the Buddha

original: de nyid rnam 'byed lam du bshad //
analyzed: de nyid rnam 'byed lam du bshad //
translated: is explained as the path that distinguishes reality.

original: theg pa rnams ni theg ma yin //
analyzed: theg pa rnams ni theg ma yin //
translated: The vehicles are not a vehicle.

original: de ni mya ngan 'da' ba min //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan 'da' ba min //
translated: That is not nirvana.

original: 'dod gzugs srid dang lta ba rnams //
analyzed: 'dod gzugs srid dang lta ba rnams //
translated: Desire, form, existence, and views

original: gnas bzhi'i sar ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: gnas bzhi'i sar ni bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as the four abodes.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes las 'byung //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes las 'byung //
translated: Arising from the mental consciousness,

original: rnam shes khyim du yid ni gnas //
analyzed: rnam shes khyim du yid ni gnas //
translated: the mind abides in the house of consciousness.

original: yid dang mig sogs rnam par shes //
analyzed: yid dang mig sogs rnam par shes //
translated: The mind, eye, and other consciousnesses

original: 'gag pa la ni mi rtag bshad //
analyzed: 'gag pa la ni mi rtag bshad //
translated: And in cessation, impermanence is explained.

original: yang na mya ngan 'das par lta //
analyzed: yang na mya ngan 'das par lta //
translated: Or else, you view it as nirvana,

original: rtag par gnas pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: rtag par gnas pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: Desiring to remain forever.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos tshigs su bcad pas zhu ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos tshigs su bcad pas zhu ba zhus pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mahāmati asked in verse:

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa //
translated: Bodhisattvas and others

original: bla med byang chub 'tshol bdag /🔽sha dang chang dang sgog btsong rnams //
analyzed: bla med byang chub 'tshol bdag / sha dang chang dang sgog btsong rnams //
translated: Seeking unsurpassed enlightenment,🔽Should they eat meat and drink alcohol?

original: 'tshal zhing btung bar bgyi mi bgyi //
analyzed: 'tshal zhing btung bar bgyi mi bgyi //
translated: Or should they not?

original: bla na ma mchis gtso mchog gis //
analyzed: bla na ma mchis gtso mchog gis //
translated: The unsurpassed, supreme one,

original: thugs rjes bdag la bshad du gsol //
analyzed: thugs rjes bdag la bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain this to me with compassion.

original: byis pa de la brkam par bgyid //
analyzed: byis pa de la brkam par bgyid //
translated: Those who crave it will be childish,

original: dri nga grags pa ma mchis 'gyur //
analyzed: dri nga grags pa ma mchis 'gyur //
translated: Smelly, and have no reputation.

original: sha ni gcan gzan rnams kyi zas //
analyzed: sha ni gcan gzan rnams kyi zas //
translated: Meat is the food of carnivores,

original: ji ltar de ni 'tshal bar rung //
analyzed: ji ltar de ni 'tshal bar rung //
translated: How can it be eaten?🔽What are the faults of eating it,

original: 'tshal nas nongs dmigs ci mchis @458b dang // ma 'tshal yon tan gang lags pa //
analyzed: 'tshal nas nongs dmigs ci mchis @458b dang // ma 'tshal yon tan gang lags pa //
translated: And what are the virtues of not eating it?

original: 'tshal dang ma 'tshal dge sdig rnams //
analyzed: 'tshal dang ma 'tshal dge sdig rnams //
translated: The virtues and faults of eating and not eating,

original: thugs rjes bdag la bshad du gsol //
analyzed: thugs rjes bdag la bshad du gsol //
translated: Please explain this to me with compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis zhu ba zhus nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis zhu ba zhus nas /
translated: The bodhisattva Mahāmati asked in verse,

original: yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and then said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la sogs pa'i slad du sha 'tshal ba dang mi 'tshal ba'i nongs pa dang yon tan rnams bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la sogs pa'i slad du sha 'tshal ba dang mi 'tshal ba'i nongs pa dang yon tan rnams bshad du gsol /
translated: Please explain the faults and virtues of eating meat and not eating meat for the sake of me and others.

original: bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyis da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa na sha'i zas la chags shing re ba'i sems can sna tshogs la rnam par phye ste chos bshad pas sems can de dag byams pa'i sems kyis phan tshun gcig la gcig lta ba dang
analyzed: bdag dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyis da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa na sha'i zas la chags shing re ba'i sems can sna tshogs la rnam par phye ste chos bshad pas sems can de dag byams pa'i sems kyis phan tshun gcig la gcig lta ba dang
translated: By me and other bodhisattvas explaining the Dharma to various beings who are attached to and hope for meat in the present and future, those beings will look at each other with a loving mind,🔽and

original: / byams pa'i sems thob nas kyang so so'i sa la gnas shing rnam par dag pa gsal bar rtog ste myur du mthar thug pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag rang gi sa la bsti zhing /
analyzed: / byams pa'i sems thob nas kyang so so'i sa la gnas shing rnam par dag pa gsal bar rtog ste myur du mthar thug pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag rang gi sa la bsti zhing /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, having rested in their own stages,

original: bstis nas kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstis nas kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will also attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: chos ngan pa log par smra ba'i mu stegs can gang dag log par lta ba dang / rtag pa dang chad pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis kyang sha 'tshal ba bkag ste sha 'tshal du mi gnang ba lags na /
analyzed: chos ngan pa log par smra ba'i mu stegs can gang dag log par lta ba dang / rtag pa dang chad pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis kyang sha 'tshal ba bkag ste sha 'tshal du mi gnang ba lags na /
translated: Even non-Buddhists who speak falsely about evil teachings, who are attached to wrong views, eternalism, and annihilationism, prohibit the eating of meat and do not allow it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi mgon @459a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi mgon @459a *//
translated: How much less would the Tathāgata, the protector of the world,

original: po yang dag pa'i chos yongs su grub pas sha mi gsol ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: po yang dag pa'i chos yongs su grub pas sha mi gsol ba lta ci smos /
translated: the one who has accomplished the true Dharma, eat meat!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati!

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //
translated: Therefore, listen very well and keep it in mind! I will explain it to you.

original: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmati replied to the Bhagavān,🔽“Excellent, excellent!🔽I will listen to the teaching.”

original: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tshal lo zhes bka' mnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshad med pa'i phyir sha rnams bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshad med pa'i phyir sha rnams bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: because the causes and conditions are immeasurable, one should not eat meat.

original: 'on kyang 'dir khyod la mdo tsam zhig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir khyod la mdo tsam zhig bshad par bya'o //
translated: However, here I will explain it to you in brief.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: srog chags rnams ni yun ring po nas phan tshun gyi rgyu rkyen gyis rtag par gnyen du gyur te /
analyzed: srog chags rnams ni yun ring po nas phan tshun gyi rgyu rkyen gyis rtag par gnyen du gyur te /
translated: For a long time, living beings have been mutually caused and conditioned, and have always been relatives.

original: 'di ltar gnyen du gyur pa'i 'du shes kyi phyir sha rnams bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyen du gyur pa'i 'du shes kyi phyir sha rnams bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Because of the perception that they have been relatives in this way, one should not eat meat.

original: bong bu dang / dre'u dang / rnga mo dang / wa dang / khyi dang / glang dang / rta dang / mi dang / gcan gzan gyi sha la sogs pa ni bshan pa dag 'dres par 'tshong bar byed pas de'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bong bu dang / dre'u dang / rnga mo dang / wa dang / khyi dang / glang dang / rta dang / mi dang / gcan gzan gyi sha la sogs pa ni bshan pa dag 'dres par 'tshong bar byed pas de'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: The flesh of donkeys, camels, foxes, dogs, elephants, horses, humans, and carnivorous animals are sold mixed together by butchers. Therefore, one should not eat meat.

original: sha ni khu chu dang khrag las byung ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sha ni khu chu dang khrag las byung ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Meat comes from semen and blood. Therefore, one should not eat meat.

original: sems can gyis de'i dri tshor na'ang thams cad 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyis de'i dri tshor na'ang thams cad 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: When sentient beings smell the odor of meat, they all become frightened and terrified.

original: bshan pa dang / gdol pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyi rnams kyis mthong na'ang de la dngangs @459b shing 'jigs pas khyis zugs pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshan pa dang / gdol pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyi rnams kyis mthong na'ang de la dngangs @459b shing 'jigs pas khyis zugs pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: When dogs see it, they bark at it, frightened and terrified, as if it were a butcher or an outcast. Therefore, one should not eat meat.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi byams pa'i sems skye bar mi byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi byams pa'i sems skye bar mi byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, it is not right to eat meat because it prevents the arising of a loving mind in yogins and yoginīs.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye bo dag brkam zhing dri mi zhim par 'gyur la snyan pa'i grags pa med pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye bo dag brkam zhing dri mi zhim par 'gyur la snyan pa'i grags pa med pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because non-noble people are greedy and have a bad smell and no good reputation.

original: rig sngags rnams sgrub pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rig sngags rnams sgrub pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because the accomplishment of the vidyā-mantras will not be accomplished.

original: 'di ltar srog gcod pa ni gzugs mthong ma thag tu mngon par chags pa'i sems skyed par byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog gcod pa ni gzugs mthong ma thag tu mngon par chags pa'i sems skyed par byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because, as soon as one sees the form of the meat, one’s mind will be filled with attachment.

original: gang sha bza' ba de dag la ni lha rnams kyis spong bar byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang sha bza' ba de dag la ni lha rnams kyis spong bar byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because the gods will abandon those who eat meat.

original: kha'i dri mi zhim par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: kha'i dri mi zhim par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because one’s mouth will have a bad smell.

original: rmi lam ngan pa mang ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ngan pa mang ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because one will have many bad dreams.

original: dgon pa'i gnas nags tshal dag na gnas pa'i tshe stag dang spyang ki la sogs pas dri tshor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas nags tshal dag na gnas pa'i tshe stag dang spyang ki la sogs pas dri tshor bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat meat because when one is staying in a forest dwelling, the smell of meat will be sensed by tigers, wolves, and so on.

original: zas kyi tshod mi zin par byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zas kyi tshod mi zin par byed pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Because it causes one to lose moderation in eating, one should not eat meat.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams yongs su skyo ba'i sems skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams yongs su skyo ba'i sems skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Because it causes the minds of yogis to become depressed, one should not eat meat.

original: ngas rtag tu ji tsam du bza' ba dang btung ba rnams la bu'i sha'i 'du shes dang / sman gyi 'du shes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: ngas rtag tu ji tsam du bza' ba dang btung ba rnams la bu'i sha'i 'du shes dang / sman gyi 'du shes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: Because I have always taught that one should regard food and drink as one does the flesh of one’s own son, and as one does medicine, one should not eat meat.

original: ngas sha bza' par gnang ngo zhes zer @460a *//
analyzed: ngas sha bza' par gnang ngo zhes zer @460a *//
translated: If someone were to say, ‘I have been permitted by the Buddha to eat meat,’

original: na de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: na de ni gnas med do //
translated: that would be impossible.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati,

original: sngon 'das pa'i dus na rgyal po sengge 'bangs bzang zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i dus na rgyal po sengge 'bangs bzang zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
translated: in the past there was a king called Good-in-Counsel-Lion.

original: sha sna tshogs la bza' zhing mi sha'ang zos par gyur pas blon po dang / gnyen dang / gnyen 'dab kyi skye bo'i tshogs rnams log nas sngon gyi dbang thang rnams kyang bcad pas nyon mongs par gyur to //
analyzed: sha sna tshogs la bza' zhing mi sha'ang zos par gyur pas blon po dang / gnyen dang / gnyen 'dab kyi skye bo'i tshogs rnams log nas sngon gyi dbang thang rnams kyang bcad pas nyon mongs par gyur to //
translated: Because he ate various kinds of meat and even human flesh, his ministers, relatives, and the people of his realm turned against him, and because he lost his former prosperity, he became miserable.

original: de lta bas na sha bza' ba la nyes dmigs 'di lta bu yod pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sha bza' ba la nyes dmigs 'di lta bu yod pa'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because there are such disadvantages to eating meat, one should not eat meat.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati,

original: de la srog gcod pa dag ni khe 'dod pa'i phyir srog bcad nas 'tshong bar byed do //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa dag ni khe 'dod pa'i phyir srog bcad nas 'tshong bar byed do //
translated: those who kill for profit kill and sell for the sake of profit.

original: gang blun po sha bza' ba de dag ni rin gyis sha rnams nyo bar byed do //
analyzed: gang blun po sha bza' ba de dag ni rin gyis sha rnams nyo bar byed do //
translated: Those fools who eat meat buy meat with money.

original: srog gcod par byed pa de dag khe 'dod pa'i phyir lcags kyu dang rgya rnams kyis srog chags nam mkha' la rgyu ba dang / chu la gnas pa dang / sa la 'gro ba dag rnam pa du mas gsod cing khe 'tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: srog gcod par byed pa de dag khe 'dod pa'i phyir lcags kyu dang rgya rnams kyis srog chags nam mkha' la rgyu ba dang / chu la gnas pa dang / sa la 'gro ba dag rnam pa du mas gsod cing khe 'tshol bar byed do //
translated: Those who kill, for the sake of profit, with hooks and nets kill and seek profit from the many kinds of beings that move through the air, dwell in the water, and walk on the earth.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: byed du ma bcug pa dang / ma btsal ba dang / 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba'i sha gang yang med pas de'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: byed du ma bcug pa dang / ma btsal ba dang / 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba'i sha gang yang med pas de'i phyir sha bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: there is no meat whatsoever that is not the flesh of one’s own relatives, that is not the flesh of one’s own previous bodies, that is not the flesh of one’s own children or parents, that is not the flesh of one’s own body.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: ngas sngar sha rnam pa lnga dang bcu bkag la /
analyzed: ngas sngar sha rnam pa lnga dang bcu bkag la /
translated: I have previously prohibited five and ten kinds of meat.

original: mdo sde 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad dang dus thams cad du thabs kyis gnang ba thams cad kyang bkag go /
analyzed: mdo sde 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad dang dus thams cad du thabs kyis gnang ba thams cad kyang bkag go /

original: blo gros chen @460b po; de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni bza' bar bya ba'ang med na nya'i sha bza' ba lta ci smos te /

translated: Mahamati, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, does not even eat what should be eaten, let alone eat fish meat.

original: gzhan yang byed du mi 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan yang byed du mi 'jug go /

analyzed: thugs rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir sems can thams cad bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar gzigs te /

original: de'i phyir bu'i sha bza' bar mi gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bu'i sha bza' bar mi gnang ba yin no //

analyzed: sha rnams dang ni btsong dag dang // ke'u dang byis ku la sogs dang // bag med sna tshogs 'gyur ba'i chang //

analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni rtag tu spang // 'bru mar dag kyang spang bya ste //

analyzed: zas las bag med skye bar 'gyur //

analyzed: bag med pa las rtog pa skye //

analyzed: rtog pa las ni 'dod chags skye //

analyzed: rmongs pas srid pa'i 'dod pa skyed //

analyzed: de yi phyir na bza' mi bya //

original: rnal 'byor pa ni de dag gis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni de dag gis //
translated: The yogi should

analyzed: des na thams cad spang byar bya //

original: phyogs bcu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: phyogs bcu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //

original: thams cad rab tu smod par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad rab tu smod par 'gyur //

analyzed: gcig la gcig ni za bar byed //

analyzed: shi nas gcan gzan rigs su ltung //

analyzed: sngar yang mthong thos dogs pa yi //

analyzed: chos shes skyo ba bskyed nas ni //

original: rnal 'byor can gyis bsod snyoms spyad //

analyzed: de phyir rnal 'byor ba dag gis //
